funding_info.funding_details: £5,000 per year, tenable for the duration of the programme of study, subject to satisfactory academic progress.

background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application for NUS Scholarships for AY2025 commences from 1 February to 19 March 2025.

funding_info.funding_details: The Lester B. Pearson International Scholarship 2026 is a prestigious, fully funded undergraduate scholarship at the University of Toronto, Canada. The scholarship will cover tuition, books, incidental fees, and full residence support (residence fees and meal plan) for four years of a direct-entry program. You receive 1,000 dollars per term for books and other necessary expenses like lab coats. The total tuition costs for a duration of four years will fully.

You must be in your final year of secondary school (high school) or graduated. All students from abroad are eligible to apply. Students from 170 countries are eligible to enroll for this scholarship. International students entering U of T directly from secondary school and starting their studies at the University of Toronto in September 2026.

Personal Statement: An essay or personal statement that outlines your achievements, leadership experiences, and why you are a deserving.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Lester B. Pearson International Scholarship 2026 is a prestigious, fully funded undergraduate scholarship at the University of Toronto, Canada, for four years of a direct-entry program. Each year approx. 37 scholars are named Lester B. Pearson.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are now open for the 2026 Lester B. Pearson International Scholarship Program, with studies starting at the University of Toronto in September 2026.

For Bachelor's students: regularly enrolled first study as Bachelor. Must be pursuing their first degree at the current level.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: up to 25 new scholars each year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be eligible to apply to study at ANU in 2027 via the ANU Direct Application system. Scholars must commence an undergraduate program at ANU in Semester 1, 2027. School leavers are eligible. Scholars are selected on the basis of intellect, character, leadership, and their commitment to Australia. All eligible applicants are considered against four criteria: Academic potential and achievements; Other significant achievements of any type. Predicted ATAR of 95 or higher (general), or 90 or higher for Educational Access Scheme (EAS) applicants. Strong extra-curricular record.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any undergraduate degree, including a special mentoring and enrichment program. Examples include law and medicine (via the MChD pathway).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Predicted ATAR of 95 or higher (general), or 90 or higher for EAS applicants. Minimum GPA of 5.0/7.0 for the MChD pathway (after completing a bachelor's degree at ANU). General ANU admission minimum GPA is 3.3 or more.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate program at ANU. For the MChD pathway, a minimum 3.0 year Full Time Equivalent (FTE) bachelor's degree at the ANU is required.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English language proficiency test required for studying at ANU, such as International English Language Testing System (IELTS) or Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic. Applicants must have completed at least one high school English course/unit in at least one semester during Year 11 or Year 12.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants eligible for consideration under the Educational Access Scheme (EAS) may apply if predicted to achieve an ATAR of 90 or higher.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: At least one high school Math's course/unit in at least one semester during Year 11 or Year 12. Commitment to Australia. Focus on personal growth, leadership, and service to the community.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Tuckwell Scholarship Stage 1 Application Form, ANU Direct Application.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: A three-stage process. Scholars are selected on the basis of intellect, character, leadership and their commitment to Australia. All eligible applicants are considered against four criteria: Academic potential and achievements; Other significant achievements of any type.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Tuckwell Scholarship is one of the most prestigious and transformational undergraduate scholarships in Australia, awarded by the Australian National University (ANU). It offers full support for any undergraduate degree, including a special mentoring and enrichment program focused on personal growth, leadership, and service to the community. Scholars are supported by experienced staff through mentoring, events, and workshops to develop leadership skills and contribute positively to ANU, their community, and Australia. Scholars House is the academic, pastoral, and social heart of the program. The Tuckwell - MChD pathway enables admission to the medical program at ANU without the Graduate Australian Medical School Admissions Test (GAMSAT).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The application process is for commencing study at ANU on a Tuckwell Scholarship in 2027. Applications for 2026 commencement opened on 3 March 2025 and closed on 14 April 2025.

basic_info.official_name: American University Emerging Global Leader Scholarship

AU Partial scholarships are available at EGL, and there are up to eight more scholarships worth $40,000 per year.

basic_info.provider: Davis United World College (UWC) Scholars Program

funding_info.funding_details: The largest, privately funded, international scholarship program in the world. It provides need-based financial aid.
covered_expenses: Costs beyond what the university itself can offer

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Exceptional young people who have graduated from one of the 18 United World College (UWC) high schools and then matriculated at selected U.S. colleges or universities. Students must apply and qualify for need-based financial aid through the university's financial support office.

Those who apply and qualify for need-based financial aid through the university's financial support office are eligible for support from the Davis UWC Scholars Program.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Co-founded by philanthropist Shelby Davis and international educator Phil Geier in 2000. It is the largest scholarship program for international students in the United States, with almost 4,000 current scholars and more than 13,000 alumni. Guiding principles include providing exceptional students with educational opportunities and transforming U.S. collegiate campuses into more globally-engaged spaces.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Founded in 2000. Annual Reports detailing milestones and achievements have been released since 2004.

basic_info.official_name: Benjamin A. Gilman International Scholarship Program

Supplemental funding of up to $3,000 is available for STEM-related coursework/internships or critical language study, potentially totaling up to $8,000. Award amounts vary based on student's recommendation group. Annually, nearly 3,000 students are awarded.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Two cycles: Fall application cycle (mid-August to early October, deadline typically October 3rd at 11:59pm Pacific Time) for programs starting between December 1st and October 31st of the following year. Spring application cycle (mid-January to early March) for programs starting between May and April of the following year.
timeline_info.opening_date: Mid-August for the Fall cycle; Mid-January for the Spring cycle.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Must be a citizen or national of the U.S.; An undergraduate student in good standing at an accredited institution of higher education in the United States; Enrolled at their home institution at the time of application and throughout their program abroad; In the process of applying to, or accepted to, a credit-bearing study abroad or internship program (in-person or virtual); Applying for programs in a country or location with an overall Travel Advisory Level 1 or 2; Students of limited financial means.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All academic fields. Supplemental funding available for STEM-related coursework or internships abroad and students studying critical languages.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: No minimum GPA requirement
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate student

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Study abroad or intern abroad (credit-bearing, in-person or virtual)

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Students of limited financial means; Supplemental funding for STEM-related coursework/internships or critical language study.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Both Study Abroad and Financial Aid Certifying Advisors must certify the application; Transcript(s) required with application; Acceptance letter from study abroad program or host institution required prior to award disbursement.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application form, transcript(s), acceptance letter from study abroad program/host institution (for disbursement).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications are reviewed by a selection committee. Award amounts vary based on student's recommendation group.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Gilman International Scholarship Program supports students of limited financial means to study or intern abroad, providing them with skills critical to national security and economic prosperity. It encourages students from all U.S. states, academic fields, and types of institutions to study or intern abroad in all world regions.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The application is open from mid-August to early October for programs starting between December 1st and October 31st of the following year, and from mid-January to early March for programs starting between May and April of the following year.

It is fully funded by donations from KU Leuven. KU Leuven is a world-leading comprehensive research university with a 600-year history, celebrating its 600th anniversary in 2025. It has a vibrant international community, with 23.8% of its students from outside Belgium.

They must demonstrate financial need, a passion for improving representation of underrepresented groups in computer science and technology, and demonstrated leadership. The scholarship aims to promote diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) in tech.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 245-303 students annually (e.g., 303 students from 59 countries in 2024, approximately 245 awards for FY 2024, or selects 300 students)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to outstanding undergraduate students who are currently enrolled in a college or university. Applicants must have one full year remaining at their home institution after the Global UGRAD Program year. Participants must return to their home country immediately upon completion of the program for a period of at least two years (J-1 visa requirement). Individuals who have participated in a U.S. government-sponsored Exchange Visitor program for more than six weeks and have not fulfilled their two-year home residency requirement by the application deadline are ineligible. Specific country citizenship and residency requirements apply (e.g., citizen of China, Pakistani citizens).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All academic fields of study are eligible, including social sciences, humanities, education, natural sciences, applied sciences, and mathematics.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Per J-1 visa regulations, interested applicants in medicine, nursing, veterinary medicine, pharmacology or other fields may have restrictions.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Currently enrolled undergraduate students (1st-3rd year students) for non-degree study.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must be an 'emerging student leader' with 'outstanding performances of both academics'.
