test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Meet the English language proficiency requirements of the intended university. IELTS/TOEFL are accepted/required.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: References (written by teachers), a letter signed by the principal approving the application, excellent references (for postgraduate studies), and a reference letter.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Between the ages of 18 and 25 for Indonesian citizens.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Demonstrate strong academic record.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: A copy of a completed Cambridge/Oxford application, certified copies of all relevant academic qualifications, reference letter(s).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Jardine Scholarship is a full scholarship offered by Jardines for study at the Universities of Oxford and Cambridge.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The application process is currently closed.

funding_info.funding_details: A fully funded scholarship opportunity for international students seeking financially supported Master’s and PhD studies in Germany. Scholarships cover the whole duration of the study program, enabling recipients to focus on their academic and social commitments without financial worries. Non-EU nationals (not educated in Germany) will receive a monthly amount of USD 934 along with various individual allowances.

timeline_info.opening_date: Application portal will be opened about 6 weeks before the deadline.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 1200-1500 scholarships are awarded each year, including about 150+ to international students across undergraduate, master's, and doctoral levels. About 180 scholarships are awarded annually for doctoral candidates.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to particularly gifted students from Germany and abroad. For international students (Non-EU nationals not educated in Germany), scholarships are primarily for graduates and doctoral students, including International Master's students with university entrance qualifications obtained outside of Germany. Applicants are expected to have excellent academic records, be socially and politically engaged, and have an active interest in the foundation's basic values, showing excellent promise for future academic and professional careers.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Applicants from any discipline and higher education institution are eligible. The scholarship is not restricted by field of study, making it highly accessible for students across sciences, humanities, engineering.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Preference may be given to studies related to the foundation's values, such as environmental science, social sciences, ecological sustainability, democracy, human rights, and social justice. Scholarships are offered to students who have demonstrated commitment to careers related to the environment.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Excellent academic performance with no minimum GPA requirement. Applicants are expected to have excellent academic records.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Scholarships are available for undergraduate, master's, and doctoral levels. For international students, scholarships are granted to graduates and doctoral students from outside Germany, including International Master's students.

experience_requirements.min_years: At least two years of professional experience post-bachelor's degree.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience, professional experience.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proof of German Proficiency is required: Level B2 or DSH 2 (with certificate).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation Letters are required, including a personal reference on your social commitment and an expert reference from a university lecturer or, in the case of new students - a schoolteacher.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must be committed to the values of ecological sustainability, democracy, human rights, and social justice. They should be socially and politically engaged, have an active interest in the basic values of the foundation, and demonstrate strong motivation.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Written application documents, including a personal reference on your social commitment, an expert reference from a university lecturer or schoolteacher, and an updated resume. Applications are accepted via an online portal.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The selection procedure consists of three stages. Stage 1 involves the submission of written application documents via an online portal.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Heinrich Böll Foundation Scholarships present a prestigious and highly competitive opportunity for international students seeking financially supported Master’s and PhD studies in Germany. These scholarships open gateways to advanced education at renowned German universities, combined with financial stability and professional growth opportunities. They offer a rare and valuable chance to talented, socially engaged students worldwide to pursue advanced degrees fully funded while contributing to important global issues.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The duration of the scholarship is generally the candidate's program duration. The standard funding period for doctoral candidates is 2 years. The scholarship covers the whole duration of the study program.

basic_info.study_country: Multiple (UK, Canada, France, Uganda, Rwanda, USA)

funding_info.funding_details: A fully funded scholarship program, described as a comprehensive scholarship providing financial aid and leadership training. It includes application fee reimbursement, transition after graduation support, two internships, work-based placements, mentorships, and other activities during the academic year.
covered_expenses: Other activities during the academic year

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by partner university and course. Examples: 21 Nov 2025 17:00 (GMT) for University of Edinburgh; early December 2025 or early January 2026 for University of Cambridge (depending on course).
timeline_info.opening_date: Varies by partner university. Example: 10 September 2025 for University of Cambridge (for the 2026/2027 academic year).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to talented young Africans/citizens from Sub-Saharan Africa/students from Africa/young people from the African continent. Applicants must demonstrate proven academic and leadership potential and have access to few educational opportunities or face the highest social and economic barriers. Admission to a Master's program at a partner university is a prerequisite for scholarship assessment. Applicants should not have previously completed a postgraduate degree and should not be enrolled (or apply to enrol) at a separate university whilst on the Mastercard Foundation Scholars Program scholarship. For online Postgraduate Diploma, applicants can have an undergraduate or Masters degree from an African university (provided they will graduate from either degree by 21 November 2025).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any full-time one-year postgraduate courses at the University of Cambridge (with specified exclusions). Health-related disciplines at the University of Toronto (e.g., Biomedical Engineering). Postgraduate on-campus (Master's) and online scholarships (Master's & Postgraduate Diplomas) at the University of Edinburgh.
field_restrictions.restrictions: University of Cambridge excludes certain courses (not specified). University of Toronto focuses on health-related disciplines.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum cumulative GPA above 2.80 out of a 4.0 GPA Scale (for some programs); typically 3.0/4.0 minimum, but competitive applicants have higher; a satisfactory scholastic average.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s degree (on-campus or online) or Postgraduate Diploma. For online Postgraduate Diploma, applicants can have an undergraduate or Masters degree from an African university (must graduate by 21 November 2025).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proficiency in English is required. Recognized tests include AUB-EN, TOEFL iBT, IELTS Academic, GRE Verbal. Other languages of instruction (French, Spanish, etc.) are possible depending on the country and university.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Most Mastercard Foundation Scholarship applications require two references.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Access to few educational opportunities; face the highest social and economic barriers to opportunity.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants should not have previously completed a postgraduate degree and should not be enrolled (or apply to enrol) at a separate university whilst on the scholarship. Specific program requirements may apply.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: The application process and decision-making are managed by each partner university. Admission to a Master's program at the partner university is a prerequisite for scholarship assessment. Shortlisting for an interview may occur.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Mastercard Foundation Scholars Program is a fully funded initiative for young people from Africa/developing countries, providing financial aid and leadership training to develop Africa’s next generation of leaders. It is implemented through a global network of 33 partner universities and non-governmental organizations.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications generally open in September (e.g., 10 September 2025 for Cambridge 2026/2027 academic year) with deadlines varying by university and course, typically in late 2025 or early 2026 (e.g., 21 Nov 2025 for Edinburgh, early Dec 2025/early Jan 2026 for Cambridge).

basic_info.study_country: Abroad / Outside Canada and the US / Multiple destination countries

funding_info.funding_details: Varies by district, typically $30,000 - $40,000. Some districts offer up to $70,000 (or two scholarships of $35,000 each). The minimum amount of any global grant is $30,000.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by district: November 8, 2025 (District 5890); May 16, 2025 (District 7010); January 26, 2025 (District 7390); March 29, 2025 (for interviews, with final application by August 1, 2025 for Rotary Foundation); December 20, 2025 (Indiana Rotary clubs).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Varies by district: One scholarship annually (District 6080); One scholarship of $70,000 or two of $35,000 (District 6040).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be at the graduate-level, proficient in the native language of the host country, and plan to study for one academic year. Study must be full-time, in-person, and abroad (outside Canada and the US for some districts). Applicants must have a background, intent to study, and future career plans in at least one of The Rotary Foundation’s Areas of Focus.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Studies directly related to one of The Rotary Foundation’s seven Areas of Focus: Peace and conflict prevention/resolution, Disease prevention and treatment, Water and sanitation/hygiene, Maternal and child health, Basic education and literacy, Economic and community development, Environment.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Not for doctorate studies. Primarily for graduate studies (Master's degree or certificate). Study must be outside the applicant's home country (e.g., outside Canada for District 5360 students).

academic_requirements.required_degree: Graduate-level studies (Master's degree or certificate)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Previous work experience, volunteer experience, and/or education related to the chosen area of focus.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proficiency in the native language of the host country is required.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two academic/employer recommendations are required.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Future career plans must be strongly aligned with one of the Areas of Focus.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants must outline and execute a service project in their study country (to be discussed during the district interview). Applicants must be available for interviews. Application requires a Rotary Club Endorsement and submission to a District Scholarship Committee. A club member should be appointed as a Sponsor.

background_and_logistics.official_website: https://my.rotary.org/en/take-action/apply-grants/district-grants (Note: This URL mentions 'Missing: (Potential Undergraduate website portal...' and the provided content primarily describes Global Grant Scholarships for graduate studies. Specific district websites are also provided in the raw content.)
background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application form, supporting documents, two academic/employer recommendations, Rotary Club Endorsement.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Consideration of applicants by Rotary Clubs, endorsement by a Rotary Club, forwarding application to District Committee Chair, interviews (required), final approval by The Rotary International Foundation.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Global Grant Scholarship replaced the general Rotary Scholarship in 2013. It supports graduate students studying abroad in one of Rotary's seven areas of focus. Over 30,000 individuals from 100 nations have studied abroad through Rotary since 1947. The scholarship is for matriculation in Fall 2025 or Spring 2026 for some districts. The task title 'Rotary District Grants (Potential Undergraduate Funding)' is noted, but the provided content overwhelmingly describes the 'Rotary Global Grant Scholarship' for graduate studies.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship periods can be 3 months, 6 months, 1 year, or 2 years (general Rotary scholarships, GGS specifically mentioned replacing it). Global Grant Scholarships typically support one academic year of study, or a two-year master's degree for specific programs (e.g., Rotary Centers).

funding_info.funding_details: The award values range from USD $5,000 to USD $15,000 per year. It is provided to international undergraduate students.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: All international undergraduate students studying on the Uptown (Main) Campus who are offered admission to the University of Cincinnati are automatically considered. Candidates from any international country outside the US are eligible to apply.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Undergraduate

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.0 cumulative university/college GPA (on a 4.0 scale) (eligibility is not guaranteed at this GPA)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: high English grade or English test score marks

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Students are required to promptly notify the Student Financial Aid Office (sfaocsc@ucmail.uc.edu) of any additional scholarships received, and they should be aware that simultaneous scholarships or tuition assistance from UC colleges, programs, or departments may impact the scholarship's value.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: required application materials (your online transfer application is considered your scholarship application)
background_and_logistics.selection_process: All international students who are offered admission to the University of Cincinnati are automatically considered based on their application and required application materials. Awards are based on the student's academic credentials.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The International Outreach Award is the primary scholarship available to international students. Students will be informed of their International Outreach Award, if applicable, shortly after receiving their admission notification.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Students will be informed of their International Outreach Award, if applicable, shortly after receiving their admission notification.

funding_info.funding_details: Recipients will get discounts on study fees ranging from 30% to 100%, or an offer for living expenses per month. For Maastricht University, 100% of the tuition fee is covered, but no additional allowance towards living costs or visa costs is granted.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Deadlines for Orange Tulip Scholarship 2025-2026 sessions vary by university. Past deadlines include 1 May (2022), 1 April (2021), and Feb (2023).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 44 scholarships from 15 institutions for Vietnam (total value 400,000 EUR). There is a finite number of scholarships available each year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Intended for students from Vietnam who want to study in the Netherlands. Applicants must be accepted at any of the eligible institutes for a full-time program or should be in the process of applying for universities in the Netherlands. Applicants must demonstrate academic excellence and be talented students.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience (considered in selection process)

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Academic Excellence

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Orange Tulip Scholarship (OTS) application form (downloadable from the official website or Nesco)
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Based on academic performance and work experience of an applicant. The overall process of file registration and selection is evaluated by the scholarship benefactor.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Orange Tulip Scholarship is a scholarship programme managed by Nuffic, the Dutch organisation for internationalisation in education. It gives talented students in several countries the opportunity to study in the Netherlands.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application deadlines vary by university. Applicants are advised to keep track of application deadlines for both the university and the scholarship. Past deadlines have been around May 1st, April 1st, or February.

funding_info.funding_details: Full financial support, amounting to RM7,800 per year and an annual home passage.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Students with strong academic results, leadership qualities, and active participation in extracurriculars. Must be eligible to work in Malaysia. Eligible nationalities: Malaysia.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Engineering, Sciences, Commercial, Business

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 8As (A/A+) in Sijil Pelajaran Malaysia (SPM) OR Excellent O-level grades at IGCSE (A*/A)
academic_requirements.required_degree: A-levels, Undergraduate (Bachelors)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Leadership qualities, active participation in extracurriculars

additional_requirements.career_plan: Passionate in pursuing a career in the energy industry
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Candidates need to complete online assessments within 10 days of receiving them via email.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Online application through Shell’s official scholarship portal. Three online assessments. Interview by the Scholarship Board of Trustees on scenario-based questions and academic & leadership experiences. Selection outcome by the end of July.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Since its inception, the Shell Malaysia Scholarship Programme has benefitted more than 1500 students in pursuing their educational aspirations and provided a unique entrance into the energy industry. The offering is for candidates to be sponsored for A-levels and undergraduates in prestigious colleges and universities locally and overseas. Designed to attract the nation's brightest minds, offering them a valuable educational journey.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications open on May 5, 2025, close on May 14, 2025. Selection outcome by the end of July.

funding_info.funding_details: fully subsidised, bond-free Scholarship
covered_expenses: cost of necessary books and equipment
one return flight to the UK

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: For students pursuing undergraduate studies at selected Colleges at the Universities of Oxford and Cambridge. Applicants must be from countries where the Jardine Matheson Group has operations, including Cambodia, Thailand, Singapore, Hong Kong, Indonesia, Mainland China, Malaysia, Myanmar, Philippines, Taiwan, Vietnam. Prospective undergraduate students.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Subject choices (general), including Education and Research, Banking and Finance, Legal, Commercial, Medical and Healthcare, Industrial and Engineering.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Undergraduate studies only.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: minimum GPA of 70%

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Excellent references, reference letter, references (written by teachers), letter signed by the principal approving the application.
additional_requirements.age_limits: between the ages of 18 and 25 (for Indonesian citizens, implies general age range)
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Strong dedication; Scholars must conduct themselves in a proper manner, complete an annual report for the Foundation, allow the Foundation to obtain information from Universities about grades/progress, advise the Foundation of any plan to change the course (subject to approval), seek written consent to defer commencement (only under exceptional circumstances), comply with University regulations, not accept other employment during scholarship periods (other than short-term during vacations) without consent, and not accept any other scholarship.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Scholarship forms, personal statement, completed Cambridge/Oxford application, certified copies of all relevant academic qualifications, reference letter, references (written by teachers), letter signed by the principal.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established in 1982. Provides more than just financial support, including mentorship by senior leaders from the Group and current Scholars and alumni.

funding_info.funding_details: This is Boston University's most prestigious merit-based scholarship. It is fully funded, covers full undergraduate tuition, and is renewable for 4 years based on academic performance. It is awarded to a select group of approximately 20 outstanding students.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to prospective domestic or international students with outstanding academic status who also make a positive contribution to their school and community. Applicants must excel academically and meet all other eligibility requirements.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Undergraduate degree in any field, including business, health, law, science, and the arts.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.9 or higher
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Significant extracurricular and leadership experience

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: High standardized test scores (e.g., SAT/ACT score of 1500/35 or higher)

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Submit the Common Application and all required materials.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Common Application and all required materials
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Trustee Scholarship is Boston University's most distinguished merit scholarship available to incoming students, providing a truly unique opportunity for exceptional students.

basic_info.provider: Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation (NNPC), Shell Petroleum Development Company of Nigeria Limited (SPDC), Shell Nigeria Exploration and Production Company (SNEPCo)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded, providing annual financial support covering tuition, accommodation, and other academic expenses. It is a merit-based scholarship jointly funded by the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation (NNPC) and Shell Petroleum Development Company of Nigeria Limited (SPDC)/Shell Nigeria Exploration and Production Company (SNEPCo). Annual grants are reported as ₦200,000 or ₦250,000.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: For undergraduate students in Nigerian universities. It is a merit-based scholarship. Some sources indicate it is for first-year students, with the grant commencing from the second year. There is also a scholarship for undergraduates in host communities (with a 2.5 CGPA requirement).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 2.5 CGPA (for host communities scholarship variant)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Currently enrolled in or admitted to an undergraduate program at a Nigerian university.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Aptitude test/examination required

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants from Shell host communities may have specific criteria (e.g., 2.5 CGPA).

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Merit-based selection, including an aptitude test/examination.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Annual scholarship program, one of the most sought-after for Nigerian undergraduates. It provides continuous support throughout the duration of the undergraduate program, with grants typically starting from the second year until completion. The program commenced in the 1950s.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The 2025 edition is now live, with applications closing on August 15, 2025.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded, generally including a maintenance grant, study and research grant, foreign study grant, mobility allowance, family allowance, and other categories. Additional funding may be available for scholarship-holders.

timeline_info.opening_date: about 6 weeks before the application deadline

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students (primarily for postgraduate and doctoral studies), European Union and German students (including undergraduates, though undergraduate applications for international students are only open to those educated in Germany). Applicants must demonstrate strong academic performance, social commitment, political interest, and an active interest in the basic values of the foundation (ecology and sustainability, democracy and human rights, self-determination and justice). Support is for all subject areas at state or state-approved German institutions of higher education. Not supported are second degree courses, study visits outside Germany, or final degree phases. Some specific doctoral grants may require applicants to be studying in Germany already.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All subject areas/disciplines
field_restrictions.restrictions: Not supported are second degree courses, study visits outside Germany, or final degree phases.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.00, or 2.50 with sufficient work or research experience. Very good school or college/university academic record is expected.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate, Master's, and PhD degrees. Proof of acceptance to PhD program required for doctoral students. Applicants should have graduated with an initial professional qualification for postgraduate studies.

experience_requirements.min_years: at least two years of professional experience post-bachelor's degree
experience_requirements.accepted_types: professional experience, research experience, social commitment, political interest

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: German language proficiency (Minimum DSH 2 or TestDaF B2 certificate required). Knowledge of English may also be expected.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Personal reference on social commitment and an expert reference from a university lecturer (or schoolteacher for school leavers).
additional_requirements.career_plan: Applicants should be prepared to take on social responsibility, be interested in politics, and work to pass on the basic political values of the Heinrich Böll Foundation (ecology and sustainability, democracy and human rights, self-determination and justice). Convincing reasons for applying and quality of research project (for doctoral students) are assessed.
additional_requirements.age_limits: No age restriction.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: May fund African students with disabilities.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Social commitment and political interest, active interest in the basic values of the foundation (ecology and sustainability, democracy and human rights, self-determination and justice).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Written application documents, including a personal reference on social commitment, an expert reference from a university lecturer (or schoolteacher for school leavers), proof of German language proficiency (DSH 2 or TestDaF B2 certificate), updated resume (CV), and proof of acceptance to PhD (for doctoral students).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Three stages: 1. Submission of written application documents (assessed on academic record, social/political commitment, reasons for applying). 2. Interview with a liaison lecturer. 3. Final decision based on all submitted information and interview report.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The scholarship aims to promote future leaders and experts aligned with the foundation's values. It offers access to a 'Green network' including experts, friends of the foundation, and regional/international offices. Alumni are invited to an annual 'alumni salon'. Headquarters are in Berlin-Mitte. Funded by the Federal Ministry of Education and Research and the Federal Foreign Office.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships are for the 2025-2026 or 2026-2027 academic year, with courses starting in April or October. The application portal opens approximately 6 weeks before the deadline.

funding_info.funding_details: Government-funded, competitive scholarship program, fully funded.
covered_expenses: monthly stipend (app. 250 USD for undergraduate students, 3,500 TL per month for undergraduate level)
one year free Turkish language course

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Around 5,000 new scholarships awarded each year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International students from all over the world; Citizens of all countries; Candidates exclusively for all candidates from all countries who wish to study at undergraduate level; Graduates or those who will graduate at the end of the current academic year (before August); Individuals who are currently enrolled in programs in Turkish universities at the level of education will apply.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Wide range of academic programs; Candidates will not be able to select any universities and departments other than those provided by the application system.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA requirements (e.g., 3.0/4.0 for undergraduate); Academic performance based on cumulative grade point average, diploma grade, national exam or international exam score.
academic_requirements.required_degree: High school diploma or equivalent (implied by 'Graduates or those who will graduate at the end of the current academic year (before August)')

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS or TOEFL; Candidates are required to meet the qualifications (SAT, TOEFL, DELF, YDS etc.) set by the universities and departments; All Türkiye Scholarship recipients take a one-year Turkish language course before starting their academic program.

additional_requirements.career_plan: Compelling Motivation Letter explaining why you want to study in Türkiye and how it aligns with your academic and professional goals.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Be in good health; Interview.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Required Documents; Candidates are required to submit/upload their applications and/or documents requested from them into the applications system.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: EVALUATION AND SELECTION includes an Interview (usually held at Turkish embassies or consulates); Results Announcement: June-July.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Government-funded, competitive scholarship program, awarded to outstanding students and researchers; Largest Turkish scholarship program for international students; Over 250,000 applications submitted last year for the 2024/2025 cycle.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for 2025 were open between 10th January - 20th February 2025; The application window for the 2026 intake is expected to open in January 2026 and close around 20 February 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship will pay the University Composition Fee at the appropriate rate (either arts or science), approved College fee, and an annual stipend. These scholarships cover tuition fees and living expenses.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Available to applicants from developing member countries of the Commonwealth, at Masters or PhD level.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any subject

academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate degree (to pursue Masters or PhD)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English proficiency tests such as IELTS, TOEFL, or equivalent test scores are required unless otherwise specified.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Trust scholarships do not automatically fund the optional writing-up period (if applicable). Scholars will be able to apply for a brief period of extension funding, should it be required at the end of their scholarship (PhD only).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must check with the Commonwealth Scholarship Commission the funding call deadlines and details of the application process, and apply accordingly; and apply for admission to the University of Cambridge by the funding deadline specific to their course (please refer to the Postgraduate Course Directory).

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Trust has given awards to students from every country in the Commonwealth, totaling more than 9,000 over 30 years.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applicants must check with the Commonwealth Scholarship Commission for funding call deadlines and apply for admission to the University of Cambridge by the course-specific funding deadline.

basic_info.provider: Turkish government (government-funded, YTB - Presidency for Turks Abroad and Related Communities)

funding_info.funding_details: Government-funded, competitive, fully funded scholarship program. It covers everything international students will need during their academic studies, offering free higher education and a new life experience.
covered_expenses: Turkish language course (mandatory for those without C1 proficiency)
Monthly stipend (e.g., 3,500 TL per month for Undergraduate Level)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Awarded to outstanding students and researchers from all countries. Applicants must be international students. Individuals currently enrolled in programs in Turkish universities at the level of education they will apply for are eligible. Maintaining a high GPA is a key eligibility factor.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Undergraduate, master’s, doctoral, and research levels. A wide range of academic programs including engineering, medicine, science, and humanities. Short-term research and merit-based scholarships, art scholarships, and joint scholarship programs are also offered.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Field changes are generally not allowed once the scholarship is awarded.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 70% academic achievement for Bachelor's degree applicants. Maintaining a high GPA is a key eligibility factor, especially for competitive majors like medicine and engineering.
academic_requirements.required_degree: To pursue full-time or short-term programs at top universities in Türkiye at undergraduate, master’s, doctoral, and research levels.

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum of 2 years relevant work experience.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Relevant work experience; working as researchers in scientific projects for master's or PhD students.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS or TOEFL may be required by the chosen university or program, with a minimum IELTS of 6.5. An internationally accepted language proficiency certificate is needed for English or other language medium programs. All Türkiye Scholarships awardees who do not possess a C1 Level Certificate for Turkish Proficiency must attend a 1-year Turkish Language Course and attain the C1 Level Certificate.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Scholarship programs usually require 1 or 2 reference letters; some universities may request up to 3 letters, especially for graduate programs.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under the age of 30 for master’s programs; under the age of 35 for PhD programs; under the age of 50 for Research Scholarship.
additional_requirements.gender_requirement: An endeavor to achieve a balance in the allocation of awards by gender.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: YTB-IsDB Joint Scholarship Program, Success Scholarships (merit-based awards for outstanding students in specific fields like engineering and medicine with enhanced benefits), art scholarships, and joint scholarship programs with international reputable institutions.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: No application fee will be charged from students.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: International exam results (GRE, GMAT, SAT, etc.) if required by the chosen university or program; International language test results (TOEFL, DELF, etc.) if required by the chosen university or program.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Evaluation and selection includes an interview, usually held at Turkish embassies or consulates in each applicant’s home country.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Türkiye Scholarships is a government-funded, competitive scholarship program, awarded to outstanding students and researchers from all around the world to pursue full-time or short-term programs at the top universities in Türkiye. It provides education opportunities at an international caliber, a wealth of knowledge and experience, free higher education, and a new life experience.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for 2025 will be received in one period, open between January 10 and February 20, 2025, for international students from all countries. The application deadline for the 2026-27 cycle is February 20, 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: Up to CAD 120,000 for Canadian high school grads pursuing STEM degrees. 100 undergraduate scholarships are awarded each year from a $200 million scholarship fund. An additional scholarship valued at $100,000 ($25,000 x 4 years) may be awarded to a Schulich Leader Nominee admitted to Science, Technology or Mathematics.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Nomination deadline: January 28, 2026 (or Jan 30, 2026 for Schulich to receive). Application deadline for nominees: February 18, 2026.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Must be graduating high school or cégep in Canada in the 2025/2026 academic year. Must be a Canadian citizen. Must be entrepreneurial-minded, exhibiting leadership and charisma. Nominees are selected by their individual schools.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics (STEM)
field_restrictions.restrictions: Must NOT plan to pursue studies in medicine afterwards.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate degree in STEM

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Entrepreneurial-minded (exhibiting leadership, charisma)

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online Schulich Leader application
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Nomination-based. High school nominations must be submitted, then nominees submit a separate online application.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Canada's most coveted and prestigious undergraduate STEM scholarships. Launched in 2012 with a $200 million fund.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: For students graduating high school or cégep in Canada in the 2025/2026 academic year.

funding_info.funding_details: This scholarship provides a 25 per cent fee sponsorship for the duration of the course. It may also cover partial or full tuition fees, and potentially financial assistance for living expenses and other educational costs.

timeline_info.application_deadline: No separate scholarship application deadline; automatically considered when applying for admission to an undergraduate program.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Offered to high-achieving international students who are enrolling in a bachelor degree. Must be citizens of countries where international educational opportunities are limited by financial disadvantage. Must have completed secondary school outside Australia, or a foundation program in Australia.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All study areas/fields.
field_restrictions.restrictions: No Special Restriction applicable.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.9, SAT of at least 1500, and ACT of at least 31 (according to the US high school system). Fsc should be at least 70%. Minimum scholarship selection scores for common qualifications for students who applied for commencement in 2025 are set out in a table (not provided in content).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor degree

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Generally no, except for portfolios for art, music.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Citizens of countries where international educational opportunities are limited by financial disadvantage.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: The scholarship is offered to the student(s) ranked highest based on their final secondary school or foundation studies results.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Melbourne International Undergraduate Scholarship is offered to high-achieving students who are enrolling in a bachelor degree and are citizens of countries where international educational opportunities are limited by financial disadvantage.

funding_info.funding_details: Multi-year scholarships ranging from $6,000 to $90,000 annually (totaling an average of $24,000-$360,000 over four years), with additional funds for enrichment activities. Some partner universities offer full cost-of-attendance scholarships.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by partner institution. Examples include November 1 (University of Connecticut - application), November 8 (University of Connecticut - supplemental application), November 12 (University of Oregon), December 10, 2024 (University of Arizona), January 7, 2026 (Virginia Tech).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 415 students receive the award every year across all partner institutions (or 360 new scholars yearly). Specific universities award varying numbers, e.g., 20 students annually at the University of Oregon (10 in-state, 10 out-of-state) and 5 annually at the University of Arizona.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Students must demonstrate academic merit, strong leadership potential, exceptional character, and a commitment to community service. Eligibility criteria vary by partner institution, but generally target first-year undergraduate students. Some partner schools are open to international students, while others may specify US citizens or residents (e.g., PA residents for University of Pittsburgh, domestic students for University of Oregon). Students from all backgrounds and areas of study are welcome.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All fields of study
field_restrictions.restrictions: Stamps Scholarships are not transferable to other colleges or universities.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: A high school GPA of 3.5 or higher (for Barry University, may vary by institution).
academic_requirements.required_degree: High school graduate applying for undergraduate (first-year freshman) studies.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Demonstrated and active leadership, scholarship, service, perseverance, innovation, and commitment to community service.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: International students may be required to take English proficiency exams such as TOEFL, IELTS, or PTE. Submission of standardized test scores (e.g., SAT/ACT) is optional and not required for eligibility at some partner universities (e.g., University of Connecticut).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation are typically required for Stamps Scholarship consideration.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Students must apply directly through partner schools; applications cannot be submitted via the Stamps website. A separate application for the Stamps Scholarship is often required in addition to the university application. Specific programs may have additional requirements (e.g., acceptance to an Honors Early Assurance Program for University of Arizona).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: University-specific application form, Stamps Scholarship supplemental application (where applicable), Letters of Recommendation.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Highly competitive, merit-based selection. Criteria include academic merit, leadership potential, and character, but specific selection criteria vary by partner institution.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Founded in 2006 by E. Roe Stamps and his late wife Penny, the Stamps Scholars Program aims to provide extraordinary educational experiences for talented student leaders. The program partners with universities, sharing the costs of the awards. Stamps Scholars often receive other prestigious awards like Rhodes and Fulbright.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships are renewable for four years (eight academic semesters) or up to 12 terms over five years for undergraduate study.

basic_info.provider: KAIST (Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology)

funding_info.funding_details: KAIST offers full scholarships to all admitted international applicants. It is a fully funded program. One source also describes it as a need-based financial aid scholarship.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International undergraduate applicants. Applicants admitted to the university are automatically considered for the scholarship.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Civil Engineering (incomplete list), Chemistry, Physics, Mathematical Sciences, Software Engineering, Artificial Intelligence.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Students must maintain a GPA over 2.7 out of 4.3 (or 3.0/4.3) at KAIST after their freshman year to continue receiving the scholarship.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree (Undergraduate)

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Required (deadline for recommendation letter mentioned)
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants who have graduated from a Korean school or will graduate are eligible to apply for this opportunity.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application using the KAIST application platform. Statement of Financial Resources online admissions application. Recommendation Letter (implied). Other application documents (implied).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants admitted to the university will be automatically considered for the KAIST scholarship. Scholarships are very competitive. Result announcement typically 2-3 months after the deadline.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The KAIST Undergraduate Scholarship is a fully funded program for international students pursuing a bachelor’s degree in South Korea. It provides high-quality education in English.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are open for the spring and fall semesters 2025 and for the academic year 2026-2027.

basic_info.official_name: International Freshman Scholarships – University of Alabama

funding_info.funding_details: Partial Funding (up to $6,000 USD) and Fully Funded options available. Fully funded scholarships (e.g., International Freshman Automatic Merit Scholarships) cover full tuition for 4 years, on-campus housing at regular room rate, and $500 for books.
covered_expenses: On-campus housing at regular room rate

timeline_info.application_deadline: December 5 (for summer and fall admits, for Summer/Fall 2026 consideration); November 3 (for spring admits).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: All International Students. Primarily for first-year students who have high ACT or SAT scores and good grade point averages from high school. Applicants must take the ACT or SAT prior to high school graduation with qualifying test scores and grade point average by the stated deadlines. Students who have taken a gap year between completion of high school and enrolling at The University of Alabama and have qualifying test scores and grade point averages may be awarded automatic merit scholarships based on the amounts advertised for the year that the student would have enrolled immediately following high school graduation.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Qualifying grade point average
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: ACT or SAT (required prior to high school graduation with qualifying test scores).

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Students who have taken a gap year between completion of high school and enrolling at The University of Alabama and have qualifying test scores and grade point averages may be awarded automatic merit scholarships based on the amounts advertised for the year that the student would have enrolled immediately following high school graduation.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Admission application, supporting documents, scholarship applications in Alabama Scholarship Award Manager (ASAM). Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) is mentioned as a general step for freshmen, but its applicability to international students is unclear.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Admitted students who meet deadlines and qualifying criteria (test scores, GPA) will be considered for automatic merit scholarships. Students may apply for additional competitive scholarships not included in the admission application through ASAM.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The University of Alabama offers generous scholarship opportunities, primarily for first-year students with high ACT/SAT scores and good GPAs. There are automatic merit scholarships and additional competitive scholarships available through ASAM.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application for admission and scholarships, complete additional scholarship applications in ASAM, complete FAFSA (if applicable), explore additional opportunities. Deadlines are December 5 for summer/fall admits and November 3 for spring admits.

funding_info.funding_details: Offer 1: Full tuition fee scholarship paid directly towards tuition fees for the minimum duration of program. Offer 2: $20,000 per annum paid directly towards tuition fees for the minimum duration of program.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be international students commencing full-time study in a UNSW undergraduate or postgraduate coursework degree program (excluding UNSW online and UNSW Canberra). Candidates are rewarded for high academic achievement, leadership skills demonstrated at their school, workplace or in their community, and extracurricular activities like sports, cultural activities, volunteer work or work experience. If receiving a Conditional English Package Offer (UEEC), students must be enrolled in the UNSW Institute of Languages and successfully complete the program prior to commencing. Must have received an offer of admission. Students who have completed a UNSW College Foundation Studies or Global Diploma Program prior to commencing an undergraduate program are not eligible for this Award.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Law & Justice, Business, Engineering, Arts, Design & Architecture
field_restrictions.restrictions: Excludes UNSW online and UNSW Canberra programs.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: High academic achievement
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate or postgraduate coursework degree program

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Leadership skills (school, workplace, community), extracurricular activities (sports, cultural, volunteer work, work experience).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Conditional English Package Offer (UEEC) requires enrollment in and successful completion of the UNSW Institute of Languages program prior to commencing studies.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must be an international student.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application form. No specific documents listed.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Requires an online application. Rewards students with high academic achievement, leadership skills, and extracurricular activities.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: UNSW’s flagship award for high-achieving international students commencing full-time undergraduate or postgraduate coursework programs.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application deadline is 15 July 2025, AEST 11:59PM. For students commencing full-time study in Term 3, 2025 (Term 2, 2025 also mentioned in one source).

basic_info.official_name: Vice-Chancellor’s International Scholarships Scheme – University of Sydney

funding_info.funding_details: Up to $60,000. Scholarship amounts vary: A$40,000 payable for one year in two equal instalments per semester; A$20,000 payable for one semester; A$10,000 payable for one semester; A$5,000 payable for one semester. This scholarship program offers four scholarship amounts based on ranking against selection criteria.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Oct 07, 2025; June 3, 2024; July 31, 2025; May 16, 2025. Deadlines for 2026 are also mentioned as looming, with Semester 1, 2026 starting February/March.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: For exceptional international students. Open to all commencing international students enrolled in an undergraduate or postgraduate coursework full degree. Applicants commencing a second degree at the University of Sydney are eligible provided they have not previously held the Vice Chancellor’s International Scholarships. No separate application needed for those with an unconditional offer. Must be an international student; have applied for but not yet commenced a bachelor's degree or a coursework master's.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum credit (65%) average calculated over the whole degree, from the University of Sydney, or an equivalent in previous studies.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate or postgraduate coursework full degree (Bachelors Degree or coursework Master's). Undergraduate and Graduate studies.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proof of English language proficiency

additional_requirements.other_requirements: You must accept your offer and pay your deposit by 31 July 2025 unless your offer states otherwise.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic transcripts. (Note: Scholarship is awarded based on academic merit from admission application; no separate scholarship application is generally needed for those with an unconditional offer.)
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Awarded on the basis of academic merit as assessed from a student’s application for admission to an undergraduate or postgraduate coursework degree.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A scholarship for exceptional international students to support high-achieving international students to pursue coursework studies at the University of Sydney.

funding_info.funding_details: The program offers various need- and merit-based scholarships. Scholarship benefits include at least $18,200 per year plus tuition fee. One recipient reported a total scholarship amount of around $70,000 a year for 4 years. The program is described as a fully funded opportunity that covers the cost of tuition and also provides a contribution towards living costs for selected international candidates.

timeline_info.application_deadline: November 15, 2025 (or November 17, 2025, 11:59 pm PST) for the International Scholars Program application. The deadline to apply to UBC to be considered for the International Scholars awards is January 15, 2026 (11:59 p.m. PST) for many programs.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: About 50 scholarships annually across four categories/awards.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Must be an international student who will be studying in Canada on a Canadian study permit. Must be entering a first undergraduate degree program at UBC from a recognized institution. Must demonstrate superior academic achievement and financial need. Applicants should be academically outstanding students from around the world who demonstrate strong leadership, community engagement, and a desire to make an impact globally and locally.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Undergraduate programs
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants applying for the International Scholars Program are not eligible for merit-based awards, including International Major Entrance Scholarships and Outstanding International Student Awards.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 90% or equivalent (A average)
academic_requirements.required_degree: First undergraduate degree

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Demonstrated leadership qualities, exceptional contributions, strong leadership, community engagement, and a desire to make an impact globally and locally.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Must meet UBC’s general admission requirements and English language standards. Standardized tests are implied as a requirement.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Teacher referee required. The applicant is responsible for requesting a teacher referee.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must be in the top 10% of graduating class. Must get nominated by your school or a non-profit organization. The applicant is responsible for initiating the award application, requesting a nomination from your institution, collecting the required information, and submitting your completed application by the deadline.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Required information (specific documents not detailed).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The UBC International Scholars Program is designed for academically outstanding international students who demonstrate strong leadership, community engagement, and a desire to make an impact globally and locally. Scholars join a community of engaged and supportive young leaders, enriching UBC and the global community with diverse perspectives and innovative initiatives. The program offers community-based experiential learning projects, annual retreats, and support from dedicated advisors and staff.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship.

timeline_info.application_deadline: UCAS Application: October 15, 2025. Scholarship Application: February 12, 2026 (noon UK time).
timeline_info.opening_date: Scholarship application opens in January 2026 (some sources specify January 14, 2026).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International students from low-income countries (or countries receiving official development assistance) who, for financial or other reasons, cannot undertake a degree in their own countries. Applicants must be first-year undergraduate students at the University of Oxford and must have secured an offer of a place for an undergraduate course. Students with deferred entry or applying for the Astrophoria Foundation Year Programme should apply for the scholarship in January of the year they will start their undergraduate degree course.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All undergraduate courses available at Oxford.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Medicine is excluded.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Usually above 3.5 or 3.7 on a 4.0 scale.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate degree (Bachelor's Degree).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Letters of recommendation from former teachers or professors.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Disadvantaged students from low-income countries who cannot undertake a degree in their own countries due to financial or other reasons.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Proof of financial need (e.g., bank statement). Stellar academic records. Receipt of award in subsequent years is subject to satisfactory academic progress.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Letters of recommendation from former teachers or professors, Proof of financial need (e.g., bank statement), Proof of English.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants must first apply for admission to the University of Oxford and secure an offer of a place to be considered for the scholarship.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Reach Oxford Scholarship is intended to provide students from low-income nations with the opportunity to attend one of the best universities in the world, despite financial restrictions.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applicants must first apply for an undergraduate course at the University of Oxford via UCAS by October 15, 2025, and secure an offer of a place. The scholarship application process then opens in January 2026.

basic_info.official_name: HKUST Admissions Scholarships for International Students – HKUST
basic_info.provider: Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST)

funding_info.funding_details: The largest amount of scholarship funding is equivalent to the full tuition fee plus an allowance of HKD60,000 per academic year, renewable for the normative duration of study (subject to satisfactory academic performance). Each scholarship is equivalent to full tuition fee plus an allowance of HKD60,000 per academic year, renewable for the normative duration of study (subject to satisfactory academic performance).
covered_expenses: allowance of HKD60,000 per academic year

timeline_info.application_deadline: Early Round Applications: November 20, 2025; Early Admission: September 30, 2025; Regular Admissions: July 15, 2026

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Academic scholarships are offered to students from different backgrounds and with different qualifications. Admissions scholarships are awarded to top students based on academic merit. Specifically targets international/non-local students. New full-time non-Chinese international applicants with outstanding performances and recommendations may apply for an Entrance Scholarship. Students must take admission in an undergraduate degree at the university to be considered for the award.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: For scholarship renewal: minimum 3.5 GPA, or 3.2/4.3 GPA, or cumulative GPA of 2:1 or above.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate degree

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendations (for Entrance Scholarship for non-Chinese international applicants)
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Financial need (for Future Leaders Award, a specific scholarship)
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Outstanding performances; exceptional academic achievements (for specific scholarships like Hong Kong Jockey Club Chairman’s Scholarship); satisfactory academic performance (for renewal).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Supporting Documents (general mention)
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Based on academic merit; interviews (mentioned for academic scholarship in middle of semester)
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: HKUST offers academic scholarships to students from different backgrounds and with different qualifications. Admissions scholarships are awarded to top students from all backgrounds based on academic merit. The university offers admission scholarships to top international students.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Online application for the 2025 intake opens on September 1, 2024, and closes in June 2025. Early application is highly encouraged. Application for students with international qualifications opens on 25 Sep.

basic_info.official_name: UdeM Exemption Scholarship for International Students – Université de Montréal

funding_info.funding_details: Tuition fee exemption/reduction/waiver, partial or full. Valued at $7,636 or 25-50% of tuition, allowing international students to pay closer to Quebec domestic rates. Not a cash award.

timeline_info.application_deadline: March 31, 2026 (general); February 1st (for all candidates); 15 Oct 2025 (for scholarship consideration, e.g., MScIH)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Must be an international student (not a Canadian citizen or permanent resident) holding a valid study permit. Must be enrolled or applying for full-time study at Université de Montréal. Open to students from all over the world.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Various fields, including Law studies and Economics. Available for Bachelor's, Master's, and Doctoral programs offered at UdeM.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's, Master's, and Doctoral programs

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Research experience (for graduate applicants), Leadership

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: N/A (No language requirement specified)

background_and_logistics.selection_process: No separate application form is required. New candidates' files are automatically evaluated for eligibility.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Designed to finance studies in Canada for the 2026-2027 academic year, with programs starting September 2026. The scholarship aims to support international students by reducing tuition fees.

basic_info.official_name: International Student Excellence Scholarship – University of Auckland

funding_info.funding_details: A Scholarship of up to $10,000 towards compulsory tuition fees.

timeline_info.application_deadline: 24 October 2024 for Semester One 2025 Intake & 1 April 2025 for Semester Two 2025 Intake. (Note: A separate deadline of 23rd October 2025 is mentioned for Semester 1 Intake for the 2026 scholarship cycle).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: New international students enrolling full-time in undergraduate degrees, postgraduate diplomas, or Master's programmes. Applicants must gain university admission with overseas secondary or post-secondary qualifications.

field_restrictions.restrictions: Students enrolling in research master's programmes are not eligible.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 6.0 (or GPE of at least 6.00) or an average score of 75% in previous studies.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate degrees, Postgraduate Diplomas, or Master's degrees (minimum 120 points).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proof of English language proficiency.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must undertake full-time study.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Awarded biannually for semester one and two. Tenure is one year. It is among the most prestigious scholarships for international students in New Zealand.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application window is open for semester one 2025 intake. Deadline dates vary by university.

funding_info.funding_details: 100% coverage of subsidised undergraduate tuition fees (after MOE Tuition Grant - scholarship recipients must take up the MOE Tuition Grant). Fully funded scholarships which cover tuition fees, monthly stipend, accommodation expenses, and may include medical insurance.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Candidates will be considered and shortlisted for the scholarship through their application for undergraduate admission to NUS. Applicable for international students (e.g., from India +238 more countries). Scholarship recipients must take up the MOE Tuition Grant. All applicants are required to fulfil the Mother Tongue Language (MTL) requirement (for admission). The scholarship does not cover students in the Concurrent Degree Programme in NUS Bachelor of Science and University of Melbourne Doctor of Veterinary Medicine.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Bachelors Degree in any discipline at National University of Singapore.
field_restrictions.restrictions: The scholarship does not cover students in the Concurrent Degree Programme in NUS Bachelor of Science and University of Melbourne Doctor of Veterinary Medicine.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: GPA ≥ 3.5 (or top 80% in Dentistry, Law, Medicine)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelors Degree

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Good conduct.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Students will be auto-considered for this scholarship when they apply for undergraduate admission to NUS. Scholarship applications can be submitted only after applications for admission to NUS have been submitted. Applicants for Dentistry/Medicine/Law will be assessed for scholarship suitability based on their performance in admission tests/interviews for those courses.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Highly coveted scholarships awarded to high calibre individuals who demonstrate academic excellence, leadership qualities and special talents. These are freshmen scholarships offering full tuition coverage and may include living stipends, accommodation, and medical insurance.

basic_info.official_name: Entrance Scholarships for International Students – HKU

funding_info.funding_details: Generous entrance scholarships that recognise students' remarkable achievements. May cover full tuition fees and accommodation and general living allowance. For IB Diploma students achieving 44 or above, the amount is 'Full'. Out of less than 150 international students admitted, 1-3 may receive a full scholarship (tuition only though).

timeline_info.application_deadline: First week of December (recommended for early application); applications accepted all year round.
timeline_info.opening_date: Applications accepted all year round, typically from December to July.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: More than 430 students (from Hong Kong and about 40 countries/regions) were awarded in 2023-24. For international students, 1-3 out of less than 150 admitted may receive a full scholarship.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Merit-based scholarships recognizing remarkable academic achievements. For International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Students, achieving 44 or above in IB Diploma. Some scholarships support students from countries under specific initiatives. Non-local applicants must apply directly to the University and meet necessary requirements. Admission decisions are based on academic performance and other factors like interview performance, personal statement, references, and other submitted documents.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: University-wide for general entrance scholarships. Specific faculty entrance scholarships are available (e.g., HKU Business School for JUPAS students in BBA, BBA(Acc&Fin)/BBA(ADA), BBA(BA)).
field_restrictions.restrictions: Some scholarships are for students from countries under specific initiatives. Faculty-specific scholarships may have program restrictions (e.g., Business School scholarships for specific BBA programs).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 44 or above in IB Diploma (for IB Diploma students). Level 5** in 5 HKDSE subjects or more (for HKDSE students).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Applicants seeking admission based on qualifications from institutions outside Hong Kong where the language of teaching/examination is not English are required to obtain specific English language examination results. Starting from the 2026 intake, IELTS and TOEFL tests must be taken within two years prior to September 1 of each admissions year.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: References are a factor in admission decisions; a letter of recommendation may be required by the university.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Interview performance, personal statement, other documents submitted to the University, and an International Student admission form are considered.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed application form, all required supporting documents (combined into a single PDF file), personal statement, references, International Student admission form.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Awarding of university-wide Entrance Scholarships is handled by the HKU Admissions Office. Admission decisions are based on academic performance and other factors including interview performance, personal statement, references, and other submitted documents. Subsequent scholarship renewal is administered by the Academic Advising and Scholarships Office.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: HKU offers various types of scholarships to support students. Entrance scholarships are prestigious and generous, empowering students from diverse backgrounds. They are merit-based and some may be renewable.

funding_info.funding_details: 25% reduction in tuition fees per semester. The reduction will be applied after enrolment and prior to the tuition fees due date.

funding_info.funding_details: GBP 2,000 off first-year tuition

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Designed to support international students who demonstrate academic excellence and true passion for their chosen field of study. Applicants must be high-achieving international students studying in the UK and hold an offer to begin any full-time undergraduate degree programme at the University of Nottingham UK (for academic year 2025 or 2026/27). English proficiency is also implied.

It provides GBP 2,000 off first-year tuition.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Minimum IELTS Score 6.5+ (Undergraduate); Minimum TOEFL score for Durham University ranges between 92 and above.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: references
additional_requirements.other_requirements: If an awardee fails to meet the academic conditions of the course for which they originally applied, the scholarship offer will be withdrawn. Awardees who fail to pass all modules or achieve an overall mark of 60% will not be eligible to receive the scholarship for the following academic year.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Valid UCAS ID on the scholarship application form, Durham Inspiring Excellence Undergraduate Scholarship online application, academic transcripts, personal statement, references.

background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship Application opens on 1 October 2025. 1st Round Scholarship Application closes on 30 January 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: A full-fee scholarship covering the entirety (likely tuition).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Awarded to academically excellent candidates. For 2026 applicants and offer holders only. Eligible international applicants will be contacted with details on how to formally apply. Must have applied for a full-time undergraduate course at the University of Warwick starting in Autumn 2026 before the UCAS application deadline of 14 January 2026.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Full-time undergraduate course in any subject area (including Foundation courses)

academic_requirements.required_degree: Full-time undergraduate course

additional_requirements.other_requirements: International applicants

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Eligible international applicants will be contacted with details on how to formally apply for the scholarship.
