Eligible applicants will be invited to complete the Warwick scholarship application, typically in March (for 2025 intake, likely similar for 2026).

basic_info.official_name: International Student Entrance Scholarship – University of Waterloo

funding_info.funding_details: Twenty scholarships, valued at CAN $10,000 each, are awarded annually.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Awarded to international students with 90%+ admission average. Open to any program. For undergraduate first-year admitted students.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any program / All courses offered by University of Waterloo.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate first-year admitted students / Year One of an undergraduate degree / Bachelors degree

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English language proficiency requirements must be met, typically IELTS level at least 6.5.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Admission Information Form (AIF) may be required for university admission.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Students are automatically considered based on their application for admission. Faculties will nominate eligible students based on the Faculty’s award allocation. Merit-based.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Awarded to undergraduate first-year admitted international students at the University of Waterloo.

funding_info.funding_details: One-year entrance scholarships are offered. Major Entrance Scholarships are valued between $12,000 and $48,000 ($3,000 to $12,000 per annum renewable for up to 4 years). Other Major Entrance Scholarships are valued at $3,000, $5,000, $10,000 or $12,000 renewable. Centrally-administered entrance scholarships are limited to receiving a single award.

timeline_info.application_deadline: For Major Entrance Scholarships: Quebec CEGEP applicants - March 7, 2025; Applicants from a school in the rest of Canada - February 7 (year not specified).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Merit-based entrance scholarships are for first-time university students entering a full-time undergraduate degree program. All applicants to McGill undergraduate degree programs are automatically considered for a one-year entrance scholarship if they meet minimum academic requirements. Students who apply for, but do not receive a major scholarship will automatically be considered for a one-year entrance scholarship. Students must meet admission requirements at McGill University and be either domestic or international. They must commence studies in any undergraduate program. Transfer, Mature, Diploma, Exchange, Special, Part-time and Visiting students are not eligible for entrance scholarships.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Undergraduate degree programs, including Bachelors degree in Music, Dentistry, Law and Medicine (for faculty-specific entrance scholarships).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: For Canadian High School (outside Quebec and Ontario): Minimum 97% average on all academic grade 12 and grade 11 level courses and/or rank in top 1% of class. For Major Entrance Scholarships, an average around 95% or in the top 1-2% in class is suggested.
academic_requirements.required_degree: First-time university students entering a full-time undergraduate degree program.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Extracurriculars are considered for Major Entrance Scholarships.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application for Major Entrance Scholarships may include details on extracurriculars.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: One-year entrance scholarships: All applicants to McGill undergraduate degree programs are automatically considered if they meet minimum academic requirements. Major Entrance Scholarships: Determined by selection committees.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: McGill's Scholarships and Student Aid offers merit-based entrance scholarships. These can be one-year or Major Entrance Scholarships (renewable). Entrance scholarships can be part of a larger financial assistance package. Certain faculties at McGill also offer their own faculty-specific entrance scholarships.

basic_info.official_name: Sydney International Undergraduate Academic Excellence Scholarship

funding_info.funding_details: 100% tuition fee waiver / full tuition fees.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: To support exceptional international students from diverse priority markets. Applicants must have applied for but not yet commenced a single undergraduate coursework degree (may include embedded honours) at the University of Sydney at the time of award which has a maximum duration of 4 years. Must be an international student and have completed secondary education.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: diverse undergraduate courses
field_restrictions.restrictions: single degrees up to 4 years

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.7+ (or First Class equivalent)
academic_requirements.required_degree: single undergraduate coursework degree

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: An undergraduate scholarship established in 2024 to support exceptional international students from diverse priority markets study across diverse undergraduate courses at the University of Sydney. It is designed to support exceptional international students who are aiming to pursue a transformative educational experience.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship duration is up to 4 years for single degrees.

basic_info.official_name: University of Calgary International Entrance Scholarship

funding_info.funding_details: $20,000 per year, renewable annually for the second, third, and fourth year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students who are not permanent residents or citizens of Canada. Must be entering the first year of an undergraduate degree program directly from high school, beginning studies in the autumn term at the University of Calgary.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All undergraduate subjects/programs

academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate (Bachelor's) degree

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English Language Proficiency (TOEFL, IELTS, PTE Academic, Cambridge qualification)

additional_requirements.age_limits: No strict age limit.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Excellent academic achievement and potential to contribute.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Based on academic merit and outstanding achievements.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A prominent scholarship honoring outstanding achievements by international students beginning their undergraduate studies.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Program starts in the autumn term (Fall 2026).

basic_info.official_name: Dr. Elemér and Éva Kiss Scholarship Fund

funding_info.funding_details: Partial annual scholarships, typically providing $1,000. The average award is $500 to $1,000 per year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be a citizen of Hungary, or a member of an ethnic Hungarian community in Slovakia, Romania, Voivodina, Serbia, or Ukraine. Applicants must be Hungarian students pursuing studies in an American college or university. Should provide record of outstanding academic achievement.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All areas of study / General studies / Field of study not specified

academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate, Graduate (including Bachelor's Degree)

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Incomplete applications will not be considered.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established in 1997, the fund was renamed Dr. Elemér and Éva Kiss Scholarship Fund as a special memorial. Since 1997, it has supported more than 100 students (some multiple times). It is part of the Hungarian American Coalition’s commitment to supporting academic excellence and leadership in the United States, Hungary, and the Carpathian Basin.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Recipients for the 2024-2025 academic year were announced. Awards were also mentioned for the 2010-2011 academic year.

funding_info.funding_details: Partial to full tuition scholarship, awarding tuition-waiver scholarships ranging from $9,000–$35,000 per year for up to 15 credits per term each year. Some sources indicate a range starting from $6,000.

timeline_info.application_deadline: New students must apply for admission to the UO for Fall 2026 by January 15, 2026. The ISSS Endowed Scholarships Application must be submitted by February 13, 2026 at 4 p.m. (PST). The ICSP Scholarship Application deadline is February 14, 2026, at 4:00 p.m. (PST).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 16 scholarships are awarded annually, though other sources suggest 8-12 or 30-40 competitive scholarships.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: New and continuing international students may apply. Applicants must demonstrate sufficient financial resources in addition to the scholarship and demonstrate financial need. The scholarship is renewable each year to completion of a UO degree, provided the student follows the requirements of the ICSP program. ICSP students are required to complete 66 to 80 hours per year of cultural service, giving presentations about their home country to children, community organizations, and UO students, faculty, and staff, serving as cross-cultural ambassadors in the Eugene-Springfield area.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Eligible full-time programs offered at the University of Oregon.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 3.0 or 3.5 cumulative GPA requirement.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate (for completion of a UO degree)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Cultural service component requiring students to give presentations about their home country to various community and university groups.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Reference Letters must be submitted (based on an older deadline, but likely still a requirement).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: New students must apply for admission to the University of Oregon. Applicants must log into the scholarship dashboard with their Duck ID, submit the Profile, ISSS Endowed Scholarships Application, and then continue with the ICSP Scholarship Application.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Profile, ISSS Endowed Scholarships Application, ICSP Scholarship Application, and Reference Letters (implied).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The International Cultural Service Program (ICSP) is a unique and prestigious opportunity for international students at the University of Oregon. It is a competitive, partial tuition-waiver award. ICSP is an essential program for international students, the university, and the Eugene/Springfield community. The scholarship is renewable each year to completion of a UO degree, provided the student follows the requirements of the ICSP program. Award amounts vary depending on world region. Approximately 16 scholarships are awarded, though some sources suggest 8-12 or 30-40 competitive scholarships. Tuition-waiver scholarships range from $9,000–$35,000 per year for up to 15 credits per term each year, with some sources indicating a lower range starting at $6,000. Students are required to complete 66-80 hours per year of cultural service.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: New students must apply for admission to the UO for Fall 2026 by January 15, 2026. The ISSS Endowed Scholarships Application is due by February 13, 2026, and the ICSP Scholarship Application by February 14, 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: A monthly stipend of NT$25,000 (approximately US$775). Tuition and Miscellaneous expenses: Up to (amount not specified).

timeline_info.application_deadline: February 1 to April 30 every year (specific instances mention March 31, 2025)
timeline_info.opening_date: February 1 every year (specific instances mention February 1, 2025 and February 1, 2026)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Varies by year and awarding office (e.g., 4 scholarships, 48 scholarships for 2023-2024 academic year, 1 scholarship by Taipei Representative Office in Ireland)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Newly admitted doctoral student with outstanding academic records (specific instance). Applicants must be above 18 years of age.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate programs, Master's degree programs, Doctoral degree programs

additional_requirements.age_limits: Above 18 years of age
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Ineligible if: An R.O.C. national or an overseas Chinese student. A person who already has and is continuing to receive any other scholarship or subsidy from the Taiwan government or any educational institution in Taiwan.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The maximum period a Taiwan Scholarship may be held is: four years for undergraduate programs, two years for master's degree programs, and four years for doctoral degree programs. The maximum duration of each recipient's total award period is 5 years.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The application period is held from February 1 to April 30 every year.

funding_info.funding_details: Merit based scholarship offering 50% tuition fees waiver/reduction.

timeline_info.application_deadline: 13 April 2024 (for Trimester 2, 2024 entry), 10 August 2024 (for Trimester 3, 2024 entry), 12 April 2025, 16 August 2025, 29 November 2025, 11 April 2026

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students from countries other than Australia and New Zealand. Applicants must be new, commencing students who have received an offer to study at Griffith University by the scholarship application closing date.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Undergraduate and postgraduate coursework degree programs at Griffith University.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Not applicable to Higher Degree Research programs, online programs, non-award courses, study-abroad programs.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 6.0 or above on a 7-point scale or equivalent
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate and postgraduate

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Students must be enrolled full-time, making progress in their studies, meet the requirements of their program of study and meet their student visa requirements to receive and maintain the scholarship, unless credit prevents full-time enrolment.

background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Receive outcome by: 30 April 2025 (for 12 April 2025 deadline)

funding_info.funding_details: $15,000 entrance scholarship in the student's first year of studies, faculty mentorship, admission to utmONE Scholars, and access to part-time on-campus employment during second year.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Automatically considered upon admission. University of Toronto undergraduate application deadlines vary by program and campus, typically closing on February 1, with earlier deadlines like November 7, January 15, and December 2 for specific programs or circumstances. Supplementary application forms for some programs may be due February 2.
timeline_info.opening_date: University of Toronto undergraduate application usually opens in September.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Targets outstanding domestic and international secondary school students who display high levels of academic excellence. For highly qualified first-year students, automatically considered upon admission. Recipients must be applying to the first year of direct-entry undergraduate studies. Open to applicants to any U of T campus.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Applicants are typically secondary school students applying for their first undergraduate degree.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: TOEFL score of 88, IELTS overall score

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Automatically considered upon admission.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic Resume or CV; Passport; Educational Documents; Statement of Purpose or Interest; Official Language Test Score (as part of the general university application).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Students are automatically considered upon admission based on their high qualifications and academic excellence.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The President's Scholars of Excellence Program is a distinction for highly qualified first-year students, automatically considered upon admission to the University of Toronto. It offers a $15,000 entrance scholarship, faculty mentorship, admission to utmONE Scholars, and access to part-time on-campus employment during second year. The program targets outstanding domestic and international secondary school students applying to direct-entry undergraduate studies at any U of T campus.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The scholarship is automatically considered upon admission. The University of Toronto undergraduate application usually opens in September. Application deadlines vary by program and campus, typically closing on February 1, with various earlier deadlines for specific programs or circumstances (e.g., November 7, January 15, December 2). Supplementary application forms for some programs may also have a February 2 deadline.

basic_info.official_name: MAECI Scholarship (Study in Italy Grant – Short-term/Living Allowance) for the academic year 2025–2026
basic_info.provider: Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI) / Italian Government

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship program. A total grant of 9000 euros, distributed in. Monthly living allowance of 1,000 euros. €3,000 for 3-month Italian language and culture courses.
covered_expenses: Exemption from enrollment and tuition fees
Health and medical/accident insurance provided by MAECI

timeline_info.application_deadline: May 16, 2025, 2:00 PM CET (for the 2025–2026 academic year)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 25 winners and 5 reserves identified (each assigned 9 months)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to foreign students living abroad and Italian citizens living abroad (IRE). Open to international and local students pursuing master’s or PhD programs at top Italian universities. Applicants must meet academic, age, and language criteria.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Higher education, advanced training, research, Master's degree programs, PhD programs, Italian language and culture courses.
field_restrictions.restrictions: For the €3,000 Italian language and culture courses, prior admission to an Italian PhD program is required.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree must be obtained before submitting the MAECI scholarship application (for Master's/PhD programs).

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience, extracurricular activities, good CV.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: B2 Italian or English proficiency depending on the program language. B2 level of English language proficiency (IELTS) is required. A minimum of A2 level certification in Italian is needed (CEFR). B2 level Italian language certificate (CEFR) is required.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Required, must be prepared by.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Research proposal or study plan required for PhD and research applicants, detailing objectives and methodology.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Master's/AFAM/Language Courses: ≤28 years. PhD: ≤30 years. Research: ≤40 years. Must be under 28 years of age at the end of the application period for Master's degree programmes.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Scholarship can be renewed for the following academic year if students meet performance requirements.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Valid passport or identity document. Curriculum vitae (CV) detailing educational background, work experience, and relevant activities/achievements.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Valid passport or identity document, Curriculum vitae (CV), Letter of (incomplete mention), Work experience letter, Official Scholarship Award Letter (for visa application), B2 level English language proficiency (IELTS) certificate, Reference letter(s), Research proposal or study plan (for PhD/research applicants).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Ranking of Winners and Reserves. Good CV with experiences and extracurricular activities can improve chances.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Designed to strengthen cultural, scientific, and technological cooperation, promote the Italian language and culture, and support Italy’s global role in education and diplomacy. Fosters cooperation in cultural, scientific, and technological fields, supports Italy’s economic system, and promotes Italian language and culture. Government-funded, centrally managed through the Study in Italy portal, aims for broad international cooperation, often has specific national quotas.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: For the 2025–2026 academic year. Each scholarship assigned 9 months.

basic_info.official_name: HKSAR Government Scholarship Fund - Scholarship for Outstanding Performance

funding_info.funding_details: HK$80,000 (approximately US$10,300)

timeline_info.application_deadline: December 31, 2025 (by 6pm) (Note: Institutional deadlines may vary, e.g., December 7, 2025)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Students of full-time publicly-funded degree or above level programmes; Students who are currently pursuing full-time publicly/UGC-funded undergraduate and postgraduate programmes; Current students with outstanding academic performance.

It covers tuition fees and provides a living stipend. Postgraduate Scholarship (PGS) for full-time PhD and MPhil students is HK$19,135 per month (wef 1/9/2025).

Full-time PhD and MPhil students who hold a first degree with second-class honours first division (or equivalent) or above are normally considered eligible for Postgraduate Scholarship (PGS). Entrance Scholarships are awarded to outstanding overseas students.

Hong Kong Scholarships for Leadership are among the most prestigious fully funded awards for international students. Postgraduate Scholarship (PGS) is tenable on an annual basis and renewable upon satisfactory progress.

Postgraduate Scholarship (PGS) basic level effective September 01, 2025.

funding_info.funding_details: Stantec will award $200,000 in global scholarships for the upcoming annual academic year (2026–27). Total annual funding of $200,000 distributed among recipients. Awards range between $1,500 and $10,000 depending on applicant needs. A minimum of five $1000 scholarships are available.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to students from all backgrounds who demonstrate leadership potential, resilience, and a commitment to shaping a better future. Eligible applicants must be enrolled in a college, university, or post-secondary institution for the 2026–27 academic year.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: science, technology, engineering, arts/architecture, and mathematics (STEAM)

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Scholarship winners will be selected and internship applicants will be interviewed in December 2025.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Stantec Future Leaders Scholarship is designed to support the next generation of leaders. Stantec will award $200,000 in global scholarships for the upcoming annual academic year (2026–27) as well as opportunities for paid internships.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship is for the 2026–27 academic year. Scholarship winners will be selected and internship applicants will be interviewed in December 2025.

basic_info.provider: Western Golf Association Evans Scholars Foundation (WGAESF)

funding_info.funding_details: Full tuition and housing college scholarship. Amount: Full-Tuition (up to $120,000).

timeline_info.opening_date: Beginning of an applicant's senior year of high school
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Varies from year to year. At least 4 new scholarships per year for the University of Chicago partnership. 340 awards were mentioned in a specific Facebook post.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: High-achieving caddies with demonstrated financial need. Must have a strong caddie record, excellent academics, and outstanding character. Must be a U.S. resident. Applicants can be high school seniors or college freshmen. Merit-based and need-based. Leadership qualities are also considered.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Open to all majors, minors, and joint degrees.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 3.0 GPA (unweighted cumulative GPA average for 2023 recipients was 3.7).

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum of two years of regular and successful caddying.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Golf caddying.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: ACT/SAT scores are optional for 2025 applicants. Average scores for 2023 recipients were 27-28 ACT and/or 1250 SAT. The Evans Scholars Foundation ACT code is 1026.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Outstanding character, leadership qualities.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Essay Required: No.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A life-changing full tuition and housing college scholarship for high-achieving caddies with limited financial means. It is the nation's largest scholarship program for caddies. Since its creation in 1930, over 12,575 caddies have graduated as Evans Scholars. Currently, 1,260 Scholars are enrolled at 27 leading universities nationwide. Funding comes from private donations, fundraising events, and golf tournaments. A partnership with the University of Chicago, formed in 2020, awards at least four new scholarships per year.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications accepted at the beginning of an applicant's senior year of high school, and from college freshmen.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.5 cumulative GPA based on a 4.0 scale

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Association membership (implied by funding and filters)

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Students who exemplify academic excellence, leadership and community engagement.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The IAPD Scholarship program provides financial support to students pursuing degrees related to the plastics industry or polymer sciences. IAPD scholarships are funded by donations from IAPD member companies and individuals in the performance plastics industry, as well as IAPD and its for-profit. Each year, the IAPD Charitable Foundation awards scholarships to outstanding students.

basic_info.study_country: 41 countries in Asia, Australia, Africa, Latin America, Europe

funding_info.funding_details: CIEE awards study abroad scholarships and grants to college students across three categories: need-based, merit-based, and other areas of funding. CIEE awards $10M+ in scholarships and grants annually. They offer travel scholarships, grant money, and study abroad financial aid.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Deadlines vary by program and scholarship type. Summer program deadlines include November 21, January 9, February 1, February 15, March 1, and April 1. A specific scholarship on scholarships.com mentioned January 9, 2026. The CIEE Gilman Go Global Grant has deadlines of March 1 (for Gilman) and April 1 (for CIEE Gilman Go Global).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Eligibility varies by scholarship. Awards are based on financial need, proven academic merit, and for specific CIEE program areas. Some scholarships may require applicants to be freshman, sophomore, or junior, Pell-eligible, or identify as an ethnicity typically underrepresented on study abroad programs (e.g., American Indian/Alaska Native, Asian, Black/African). All applicants must complete the CIEE Study Abroad Scholarships & Grants task on their application.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 2.5 GPA for programs; some scholarships require a 3.0 GPA.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Pell-eligible; identify as an ethnicity typically underrepresented on study abroad programs (e.g., American Indian/Alaska Native, Asian, Black/African).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Brief 300-word or less essay for merit-based scholarships.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: CIEE Study Abroad Scholarships & Grants task on their application; brief 300-word or less essay for merit-based scholarships.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: CIEE offers study abroad scholarships and grants to college students across three categories: need-based, merit-based, and other areas of funding, for programs in over 200 programs in 41 countries.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applying for a scholarship abroad can be done in three simple steps: Search for your dream study abroad program, Start your application, Complete the Scholarship & Grants application before the deadline.

funding_info.funding_details: AUD 10,000 per annum for the first year of study, renewable for subsequent years based on academic performance. It is a merit-based scholarship.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Must be an international student. Must have received an offer or be currently enrolled at Monash University. Must have a full Monash course offer (no conditions). Open to high-achieving students. Eligible for undergraduate, postgraduate (Masters/Coursework) degrees.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Medical & Health Sciences, Arts, Education (Research), Science (Water Resources)

academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate, Masters (Coursework), Postgraduate

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must plan to study full-time.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The scholarship is merit-based.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for 2025 are currently open. Applications for 2026 have closed.

basic_info.provider: U.S. Government (administered by Fulbright Commissions and Institute of International Education - IIE)

funding_info.funding_details: A one-year, non-degree, full scholarship providing professional enrichment and non-degree graduate-level study. It covers tuition and fees, a monthly maintenance allowance/living stipend, accident and sickness program, international travel, and travel within the U.S. as required. It does not cover expenses for accompanying family members.
covered_expenses: Full tuition fees for academic studies
Monthly maintenance allowance / Living stipend for accommodation, meals, and personal expenses
Travel within the United States as required

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by country; examples for the 2026-2027 cycle include July 31, 2025 (Nepal), August 1, 2025 (Gambia), August 7, 2025 (Maldives), and August 8, 2025 (Philippines).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: About two hundred Fellowships are awarded annually; specific country allocations may vary (e.g., 7 awards for Australia in current intake).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: For accomplished mid-career professionals from designated countries. Applicants must contact their U.S. Embassy or Binational Fulbright Commission in their home country for complete application details and a listing of eligible countries. The fellowship does not cover expenses for accompanying family members.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Focuses on contemporary development issues. Examples include Economic Development, Finance and Banking, Public Policy Analysis and Public Administration, Technology Policy and Management. Policy makers and administrative managers are suitable. A comprehensive list of approved fields of study is available for download.
field_restrictions.restrictions: The program is for non-degree graduate-level study. Individuals primarily concerned with expanding a corporate focus may not be suitable.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Varies by country; examples include a cumulative GPA of at least 2.75 on transcript for a bachelor's degree (Thailand) or at least 85/100 points in the Guatemalan system / ranking in the top 15 percent of their class (Guatemala).
academic_requirements.required_degree: This is a non-degree graduate-level study program. Candidates are typically experienced professionals; a doctoral degree or equivalent in medicine, health, behavioral or social science is preferably for some fields/countries (e.g., Estonia).

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum of five years full-time professional experience in the relevant field (prior to application deadline).
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Mid-career professionals, experienced professionals, policy makers, and administrative managers.

additional_requirements.age_limits: Preferably from 30 to 55 years of age (e.g., Thailand).
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: The Fellowship does not cover the expenses of the grantee's accompanying family members.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Specific country requirements apply, such as being a citizen in good health (Thailand) or specific GPA/class ranking (Guatemala).

background_and_logistics.official_website: Primary: http://www.humphreyfellowship.org. Also administered by the Institute of International Education (IIE) and U.S. Department of State (exchanges.state.gov, iie.org).
background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application instructions and a list of approved fields of study are available for download. Applications must be submitted through the U.S. Embassy or Binational Fulbright Commission in the applicant's country, often via an online portal.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A one-year (10 months) program providing professional enrichment and non-degree graduate-level study in the United States. Fellows are placed in groups by professional field at selected U.S. universities offering specially designed programs of study and training.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The 2026-2027 Hubert H. Humphrey Fellowship Program is currently open for applications.

basic_info.official_name: The University of Adelaide Global Citizens Scholarship

funding_info.funding_details: Scholarship recipients will receive a 15% or 30% reduction toward international tuition fees for the minimum standard duration of the program, rewarding international students who have achieved academic merit in their previous studies.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Automatically awarded upon admission; no specific application deadline for the scholarship itself. Admission deadlines may vary, with some sources indicating 'Ongoing' or specific dates like '31-12-2025' or 'July 04, 2025'.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Rewards international students commencing in an undergraduate or postgraduate qualification who have received academic merit in their studies. Available for commencing direct-entry international undergraduate and postgraduate coursework students, including those who are required to undertake a Pre-Enrolment English Program (PEP) prior to their degree commencement. Must have a University of Adelaide offer or admission (full or conditional) as a full-fee paying international student. Not available for current University of Adelaide students transferring from one program to another prior to successful completion of their program of study (internal transfers). Applicants who completed the Foundation Studies Program (FSP) or Diploma Program at Eynesbury must have achieved a minimum FSP score of 395 or minimum GPA of 6.0.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any discipline
field_restrictions.restrictions: Some exceptions apply.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum FSP score of 395 or minimum GPA of 6.0 for applicants from Foundation Studies Program (FSP) or Diploma Program at Eynesbury.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate or postgraduate coursework qualification.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Overall IELTS band score of 6.5, with a minimum of 6.0 in listening, reading, writing, and speaking for all programs except language-rich disciplines (required for university admission).

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must be a full-fee paying international student.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Automatically awarded to students who meet the eligibility requirements upon admission.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The University of Adelaide Global Citizens Scholarship rewards international students who have achieved academic merit in their previous studies, offering financial assistance through tuition fee reductions. Contact: Email: monica.ruston@adelaide.edu.au, Phone: +61 8 8313 4455, Address: University of Adelaide North Terrace, Adelaide, South Australia.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship is automatically awarded to eligible students upon admission. Application cycle for admission is 2025-2026. No specific closing dates for the scholarship itself, though university admission deadlines may apply.

basic_info.study_country: France, Germany, Hong Kong, Hungary, Ireland, Latvia, Netherlands, Poland, UK, United States

funding_info.funding_details: Fully-funded scholarships for master's degree study.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Individuals who clearly demonstrate academic and professional excellence and a deep commitment to leading positive social change in their communities. Awards are available to citizens of Azerbaijan, Belarus, Cambodia, Ethiopia, Laos, South Sudan, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan, and 17 countries across Africa, Eurasia, South-East Asia and the Middle East. Applicants must demonstrate maturity, flexibility and civil society leadership potential.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Communications, Journalism & Media, Culture, History & Society, Development Studies, Economics, Education Management & Leadership, Environment & Natural Resource Management, Gender Studies, Human Rights, Law (including Human Rights law), Politics & International Studies, Public Health Policy & Health Management, Public Policy & Administration, Social Work & Social Policy. Specific programs include Master of Arts in European Studies on Science, Society and Technology, Master of Science Economics.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor’s degree (as of May 2020) with an excellent academic record

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional experience related to your chosen field of study.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Adequate language test score required; appropriate language proficiency.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Deep commitment to leading positive social change in their communities. Commitment to open society values. Proposed field of study should be logical for the goals expressed in the essays. Application itself should be organized and complete.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application form, essays (implied).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Application reviewed by CSLA staff and international experts to assess eligibility, competitive potential, and fit with the goals of the program. Finalists must obtain an adequate language test score, gain admission at a CSLA host university, and do so within the CSLA staff-led placement process. Uncompetitive and/or ineligible applicants will be notified in late August.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Post-graduate scholarship funding supporting civil society building, social justice, democratic governance, and human rights.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application deadline May 15, 2019. Application review by CSLA staff and international experts begins after May 15, 2018 (for a past cycle). Notification of uncompetitive/ineligible applicants in late August.

funding_info.funding_details: Annual tuition fee discount. Value up to $48,000.00. Automatically deducted from tuition fees each semester (twice annually). Example: $10,000 p.a. Scholarship.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: For high-achieving undergraduate and postgraduate international students (excluding Australia). Must meet minimum academic requirements: minimum ATAR 85.00, or minimum WAM 65.00 (or equivalent 65+), or grades of AAA (15 points) or above at A-level. Also applicable if studying an approved International Academic Pathway (Articulation Program).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Undergraduate, Masters, and Postgraduate (by coursework). Some PhD courses are also eligible.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Excluded: Assured Pathway to Medicine, Assured Pathway to Dental Medicine, Juris Doctor, Doctor of Medicine, Doctor of Dental Medicine, Doctor of Podiatric Medicine, Doctor of Clinical Dentistry. (Note: One source also excludes Doctor of Philosophy and Master of Clinical, while another lists some PhD courses as eligible).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: minimum ATAR 85.00, minimum WAM 65.00 (or equivalent 65+), or grades of AAA (15 points) or above at A-level.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate, Masters, and Postgraduate (by coursework). Some PhD courses are also eligible.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must be an international student (excluding Australia)

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The UWA Global Excellence Scholarship is offered by the University of Western Australia to high-achieving undergraduate and postgraduate students. It provides an annual tuition fee discount for the normal full-time duration of the awardee's course, aiming to provide an affordable world-class education.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Status Open

basic_info.official_name: York University International Entrance Scholarship of Distinction

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded. Total value of $37,500, awarded as $15,000 in the first year and $7,500 annually for an additional three years (total 4 years).

timeline_info.application_deadline: No separate scholarship application required; consideration is automatic upon admission application.
timeline_info.opening_date: Applications are now open for the 2025–2026 academic year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Available to International Students enrolled full-time in undergraduate programs at York University, paying international tuition fees. Consideration is automatic based on final admission average. For renewal, recipients must maintain full-time status (minimum of 18 credits each year).

field_restrictions.restrictions: Students admitted to Computer Science, Computer Security and Engineering programs are ineligible.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Based on final admission average. For Indian students applying to undergraduate programs, completion of Class XII with at least 55% in their top five academic subjects is required for admission.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate programs (requires completion of Class XII or equivalent for admission).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: No award application required. Some admission programs may require supplementary applications.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Automatic consideration based on final admission average.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A prestigious entrance scholarship designed to celebrate the achievements of international undergraduate applicants.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2025-2026 academic year are open. Admission deadlines for automatic scholarship consideration include: January 15, 2025 (Fall 2025 for Ontario high school students), November 15, 2025 (Winter 2026 intake), December 1, 2025 (Fall 2026 intake). OUAC application available from December 2025 to April 1, 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: A full four-year scholarship to one of QuestBridge's college partners, providing early admission and a full four-year Match. The Match Scholarship is worth over $325,000.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 2,627 Finalists matched in a recent year (over 17,000 cumulative scholarships awarded)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: The National College Match is for high-achieving, low-income high school seniors. Applicants must be U.S. Citizens and Permanent Residents OR students, regardless of citizenship, currently attending high school in the U.S. Candidates are academically distinguished with demonstrated financial need. Most finalists who match have a Student Aid Index (SAI) of -1500.

academic_requirements.required_degree: High school seniors applying for an undergraduate degree

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: High-achieving students from low-income backgrounds are specifically targeted.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: National College Match application
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Students submit their National College Match application in September. QuestBridge reviews applications to determine if they will be Finalists. Finalists who do not match or choose not to rank colleges can use their QuestBridge application to apply to college partners through other early and regular decision opportunities.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A unique college and scholarship application process that combines early admission and a full four-year scholarship for academically distinguished high school seniors with demonstrated financial need.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The National College Match application opens in late summer. Students submit their application in September, with a late September deadline to be considered for Finalist status.

funding_info.funding_details: $20,000 scholarship; 500 awards available.
covered_expenses: Scholarship to lessen loans and debt
discounted legal, financial, health, and personal services

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: High school seniors on track to graduate from an accredited high school, dedicated to pursuing a college education, who have participated in an approved college readiness program in grades 11 and 12. Applicants must demonstrate financial need (Pell Grant Eligible) and have overcome adversity, showing grit, potential, and ambition. The program places greater emphasis on determination to succeed than academic record and test scores.

academic_requirements.required_degree: bachelor’s program

additional_requirements.reference_letters: one letter of recommendation
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Overcame Adversity, Pell Grant Eligible
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must plan to enroll at an accredited bachelor’s program the fall directly after high school graduation. Complete one essay.

application_documents: a copy of high school transcript
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Implies a multi-stage process, starting with an online application. Semifinalists are asked to provide additional documents.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A scholarship and college completion program that nurtures and empowers students on their path to a college degree. Since 2004, the Michael & Susan Dell Foundation has supported 6,000 scholars, including more than 4,500 college graduates. Emphasizes determination to succeed over academic record and test scores.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application opens on October 1. Submission deadline is on December 1.

funding_info.funding_details: $20,000 scholarship awarded to 150 students each year. The Coca-Cola Scholars Foundation supports more than 1,400 exceptional college students each year, with annual scholarships of $3.55 million awarded through 3 nationally recognized programs.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Achievement-based scholarship awarded to students in their final year of high school (High School Senior). Must be currently enrolled in high school with plans to graduate the following year. Only students who are eligible to apply for Federal Financial Aid are eligible (includes Asylum-Seeker or Asylee, Conditional Permanent Resident, Cuban or Haitian Entrant, and implicitly US Citizens/Permanent Residents). Immediate family members of Coca-Cola Company employees or Coca-Cola Scholars Program staff are not eligible.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.0 on a 4.0 scale
academic_requirements.required_degree: High School Senior (for application), Undergraduate (for scholarship use)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Academic, service, social, and career (employment/internship/externship) experiences (for resume content)

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Required, at least one recommendation letter from a faculty member for semifinalist applicants.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must have taken at least three courses in English, math, science, and social studies.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Professional resume outlining academic, service, social, and career experiences; One-page typed or printed personal statement/essay; Recommendation letter from a faculty member.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Phase 1 application is open August 1 - September 30. Applicants are whittled down to 2,000 semifinalists. Semifinalists advance to Phase 2 and are notified by November 5.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Coca-Cola Scholars Program scholarship is an achievement-based scholarship awarded to high school seniors to support their undergraduate education at any accredited U.S. college or university for 4 years.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application opens August 1 and closes September 30 each year. Semifinalist notification by November 5.

basic_info.official_name: Yenching Academy Scholarship at Peking University

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded Master's scholarship. Provides full tuition plus a generous stipend to cover travel and living expenses.
covered_expenses: accommodation (in the residential college/Yenching Academy House)
travel expenses (one round-trip journey to and from Beijing)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to all with a Bachelor's degree. No citizenship requirement, but deadlines and processes may differ for international, Hong Kong, Macao, Taiwan, or China citizens.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s degree program in China Studies (interdisciplinary classroom and field study of Chinese history and culture, real-time issues in China’s development). For English speakers with varied levels of Chinese language competency.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 2.50 (or the equivalent). Most successful applicants will have 3.7+.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Minimum of a Bachelor's degree in any field, or currently enrolled on a degree program awarded no later than August 31 of the year in which they wish to enroll. Master's-level scholarship.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English proficiency required (IELTS: 7.0, TOEFL iBT: 100 or exemptions if studied in English).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two Academic Letters of Recommendation and Two Yenching Recommendation Forms.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: If from Partner Universities, apply through home university's internal pre-selection process. Students from Hong Kong, Macao and Taiwan need to apply through both the Peking University Graduate Admissions website and the Yenching Academy online admissions portal, with an additional Peking University deadline in January 2026 for HMT applicants. Campus deadlines for some institutions are earlier (e.g., Nov 1st/4th).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: No application fee. An outstanding academic record; Strong interest in interdisciplinary study of China; A record of extracurricular achievement, community engagement, social responsibility, and leadership potential. Significant co-curricular achievements.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed online application form (via Yenching Academy admissions portal), Personal statement (max. 750 words), Two Academic Letters of Recommendation, Two Yenching Recommendation Forms.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: One- or two-year Master of Arts in China Studies degree program. Intensive program of interdisciplinary classroom and field study of Chinese history and culture, as well as real-time issues in China’s development. Prepares a diverse group of exceptional international and Chinese students. Includes field excursions and an intensive Chinese language program. Residential program.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications open September 10, 2025. Deadline is December 1, 2025 (9:00 am Beijing Time). Campus deadlines for some institutions are earlier (e.g., Nov 1st/4th). HMT applicants have an additional Peking University deadline in January 2026.

basic_info.official_name: International Talents @Unibo: scholarships for international students

funding_info.funding_details: A study grant of €6,500 gross; Full exemption from tuition fees. Scholarships and exemptions are awarded for two academic years.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Deserving international students enrolling in second cycle degree programmes (Master's); Must have obtained, or be in the process of obtaining, a qualification from a non-Italian education system that qualifies them for admission to a second-cycle degree program at the University of Bologna; Must have taken the GRE test by the application deadline; Verification of financial status (ISEE 2025 certificate or equivalent financial status certification is required if the applicant’s income/assets are outside Italy); Cannot be granted to students who register in multiple or joint programs for which the fees have to be paid to a partner university.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Second Cycle Degree Programmes (Master’s degree programs). Examples include engineering, social sciences, health, humanities, and International Horticultural Science.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Students who register in multiple or joint programs for which the fees have to be paid to a partner university.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 3.0 GPA
academic_requirements.required_degree: Second Cycle Degree Programmes (Master's)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English proficiency

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: The University of Bologna welcomes and supports students from the Gaza Strip and offers 9 scholarships for those who enrol in degree programmes or single learning activities in the a.y. 2024/25 (these are separate from the 30 International Talents @Unibo scholarships); Students granted international protection are eligible to participate in the competition for scholarships offered by the Italian Ministry of the Interior in partnership with CRUI.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Register on the University of Bologna’s application portal; Complete the online application form for the 'International Talents @Unibo' scholarship; Send GRE scores to the University of Bologna (Institution Code: 7850).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: GRE test results; Documentation on the family's economic situation (ISEE 2025 certificate or equivalent financial status certification); Qualification from a non-Italian education system.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Based on GRE test scores and the verification of financial status.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The International Talents @Unibo scholarship program is an initiative by the University of Bologna to attract and support outstanding international students enrolling in second-cycle (master’s) degree programs.

funding_info.funding_details: $5,000 educational stipend

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to graduate and undergraduate students. Must be a full-time student during the entire scholarship award term. Available to citizens of all world countries (international students are eligible).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Concrete-related degree programs including construction, construction management, design, structures, architecture, materials, forensic engineering, civil engineering, concrete technology, and CIM programs.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.0 on a 4.0 scale
academic_requirements.required_degree: Graduate or undergraduate degree programs

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proof of English proficiency required, such as TOEFL, IELTS, or a written statement attesting proficiency if English is not native language.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Resume (in Microsoft Word .doc format), English proficiency test scores (TOEFL, IELTS) or a written statement.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Finalist notification in February 2026, interviews on March 29, 2026.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The scholarship is for the 2026-2027 academic year, covering the 2026 fall semester. It includes recognition in Concrete International magazine. The stipend is paid in two equal installments over one year directly to the student. The program includes both fellowships and scholarships.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications generally open July 1 and close November 1 of each year.

basic_info.official_name: Tsinghua University Scholarships (including Chinese Government Scholarship (CGS), Schwarzman Scholars Program, Beijing Government Scholarship)
basic_info.provider: Tsinghua University (host institution), Chinese Government (for CGS), Beijing Government (for Beijing Government Scholarship)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded. Full CGS covers tuition fees, free university dormitory or accommodation subsidy, stipend, and medical insurance. Partial CGS includes one or a few items in the Full CGS. Beijing Government Scholarship covers tuition costs in full or in part.
covered_expenses: Free university dormitory or accommodation subsidy

timeline_info.application_deadline: February 28, 2026 (for Chinese Government Scholarship); 15 October 2025 (for MScIH scholarship consideration for 2026 intake)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 60 (for Chinese Government Scholarship at Tsinghua University)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Non-Chinese citizens with a valid ordinary-type passport, applying for full-time international graduate (Master's or PhD) programs. Outstanding students.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s Degrees, Doctoral Degrees, Joint Graduate Programs, Graduate Programs in English

academic_requirements.required_degree: Relevant prior degree for Master's or Doctoral programs (e.g., Bachelor's for Master's, Master's for PhD)

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Tsinghua University only selects scholarship candidates from pre-admitted students.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Evaluation and Admission; Scholarship candidates are selected from pre-admitted students.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Duration: up to 3 years for Master's degree programs and up to 4 years for Doctoral degree programs. Subject to Annual Review. Program start: September 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: Bocconi University Scholarships (including Merit and International Awards) are fully funded scholarships for international students for the 2026-2027 academic year. The Merit Award provides a full tuition waiver (worth up to approximately €12,000 per year for Undergraduate and €13,000 per year for Graduate programs) and free accommodation. The International Award consists of a 50% tuition reduction (worth approximately €6,000 per year). The Bocconi Graduate Merit Award covers full tuition and fees for the academic year 2025-2026. Students admitted to the MSc in Cyber Risk Strategy and Governance may receive the Cyber Partnership Scholarship, equivalent to the Bocconi Graduate Merit Award.
covered_expenses: Full or partial tuition fee waivers

timeline_info.application_deadline: November 30, 2025 (for Undergraduate Merit Awards); December 3, 2025 (for Bachelor and Law Programs, Early Session/HEC 1st round AY 2026-27); Align with admission rounds (e.g., November 2024 to May 2025 for graduates).
timeline_info.opening_date: November 12, 2025 (for Bachelor and Law Programs, Early Session/HEC 1st round AY 2026-27); Applications for Bocconi University Scholarships are currently open.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Outstanding International Applicants who are admitted to the first year of a Bachelor Program or Master of Science program at Bocconi University. Academic profile must be considered amongst the top applicants. Evaluation is primarily based on the candidate's academic achievement (GPA, SAT or GMAT score) together with the personal profile (CV). Renewal for subsequent years (maximum 2 years, or 4 years for Law programs) is automatic if required minimum GPA and academic progress conditions are met (e.g., earning at least 50 credits as of August 10 for AY 2025-2026).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Bachelor Program, Master of Science program (including MSc in Cyber Risk Strategy and Governance, Joint Degree with Politecnico di Milano).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Required minimum GPA (specific value not provided)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Admission to the first year of a Bachelor Program or Master of Science program at Bocconi University. Qualification must be acquired by October 2026 or the first graduation session available after the summer break (for Master of Science international applicants).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English proficiency is required. Valid test scores may be necessary depending on the program. Specific requirements mentioned: IELTS Academic: 6.5 with at least 6 in every section; TOEFL IBT: 88; Duolingo English test: 110. GRE/GMAT score is highly recommended.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must be international students.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online Admissions Application, CV, SAT or GMAT score, English proficiency test scores (IELTS/TOEFL/Duolingo), GRE/GMAT score (highly recommended).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Candidates are considered for the Bocconi Merit and International Awards based on their admission’s application submitted to Bocconi University. No separate scholarship application is required. Selection is based on academic achievement (GPA, SAT/GMAT score) and personal profile (CV). Awarded students will need to follow the procedure indicated in the admission results and complete the online scholarship acceptance procedure.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Bocconi Merit and International Awards are offered by Bocconi University, a leading private university in Business and Economics in Italy, founded in 1902. The university is widely recognized as one of the top European institutions of higher learning and research in the social sciences. These awards are for outstanding international students pursuing Bachelor or Master of Science programs. The Merit Award offers a full tuition waiver and free accommodation, while the International Award offers a 50% tuition reduction.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships are available for the Academic Year 2026-2027, with applications for some programs opening in November 2025 and deadlines in late November/early December 2025, aligning with admission rounds.

funding_info.funding_details: International President’s Entrance Scholarships is a partially funded scholarship. Western offers three automatic scholarships: Excellence ($8000), Distinction ($3,500), and Admission ($2,500). There are also Three $100,000 International President's Entrance Scholarships and Five $50,000 scholarships for international students.

timeline_info.application_deadline: March 15th (for guaranteed consideration for Western International Admission Scholarships); March 1 (for general scholarships applications completed before this date)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Three $100,000 International President's Entrance Scholarships and Five $50,000 scholarships for international students. The number of Excellence ($8000), Distinction ($3,500), and Admission ($2,500) automatic scholarships is not specified.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students entering full-time undergraduate studies at Western University. Consideration for the Western International Admission Scholarships is guaranteed if the admission application through the Ontario Universities’ Application Centre (OUAC) along with all supporting documents is submitted by March 15th. Automatic scholarships are for students admitted directly from secondary school.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: For Western Admission Scholarship: 90.0% to 91.9%. For Western Scholarship of Excellence: Top high school admission averages.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Submission of admission application through the Ontario Universities’ Application Centre (OUAC) along with all supporting documents by March 15th for guaranteed consideration.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Admission application through the Ontario Universities’ Application Centre (OUAC) along with all supporting documents.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Western University offers various undergraduate admission scholarships, including President's and International scholarships. Specific awards include the International President's Entrance Scholarships (partially funded, with some valued at $100,000 and $50,000), and automatic scholarships (Excellence $8000, Distinction $3,500, Admission $2,500) for students admitted directly from secondary school. The Meena and Amit Chakma International Student Scholarship is also available for international students entering full-time studies. Guaranteed consideration for Western International Admission Scholarships requires submission of the admission application and supporting documents via OUAC by March 15th. Note: This information pertains to Western University (UWO) in Canada, not Western Washington University (WWU), Western Illinois University (WIU), or Western Kentucky University (WKU).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The general application for 2025-2026 scholarships opens December 1, 2024. Applications completed before March 1 are considered. Guaranteed consideration for Western International Admission Scholarships requires submission of the admission application and supporting documents via OUAC by March 15th.

funding_info.funding_details: SMU scholarships generally cover all or part of tuition fees, sponsor university-related overseas trips, and may include a stipend for living expenses and textbooks. Award amounts vary, with some ranging from $500-$4,000 for study abroad, and an average award of $21,500.00 to each student. The Sumners Foundation Scholarship specifically covers full tuition, fees, and a stipend for living expenses and textbooks. Some scholarships offer full sponsorship or tuition fee waivers/subsidies.

timeline_info.application_deadline: 19 March (for Academic Year 2026-27); 02 Dec, 2025 (for Annual Scholarships for Study Abroad 2025)
timeline_info.opening_date: 17 November 2025, 12.00pm Singapore Standard Time (for Academic Year 2026-27); 14 Nov 2025 (for MOE-START/Overseas PG Scholarship Intake 2026)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Eligibility varies by scholarship. General criteria include: Singapore Citizens or Permanent Residents (for some scholarships like GMC, Wee Kim Wee, STEM); local and foreign undergraduates (for SCIS, CCPL); first-year full-time undergraduates (Dato' Kho Hui Meng); outstanding law undergraduates and postgraduates (JD) (Kwa Geok Choo); working adults 25 years or older or with extensive work experience (SMU Elevate); demonstrated financial need (for some, like GMC, and grants requiring FAFSA submission); good academic results (minimum cumulative GPA of 3.00 for GMC, Wee Kim Wee); outstanding academic performance in STEM subjects and passion for scientific research (for STEM scholarships); demonstrated leadership (Wee Kim Wee).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Information Systems, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Law (undergraduate and postgraduate JD), STEM subjects. Some scholarships are open to any degree programme.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.00 (minimum cumulative GPA for some scholarships like GMC, Wee Kim Wee)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate (including first year/freshmen), Postgraduate (JD)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Working adults, extensive work experience (for SMU Elevate Scholarship)

additional_requirements.age_limits: 25 years or older (for SMU Elevate Scholarship)
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Demonstrated financial need; Passion for scientific research; Demonstrated leadership
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Maintain a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA); Submit the FAFSA (for grants, implies financial need)

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Only shortlisted applicants are selected for final interviews (e.g., March 2026 Final Interview for MOE-START/Overseas PG Scholarship).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Singapore Management University (SMU) offers a wide range of scholarships aimed at nurturing future leaders. These include specific scholarships like the SMU Elevate Scholarship (established 2024 for working adults), SMU School of Computing and Information Systems (SCIS) Scholarship, CCPL Scholarship (established 2022), Dato' Kho Hui Meng Scholarship (established 2019), Nuri Foundation, Cheung Family, BIS Merit, School of Economics, School of Accountancy Financial, SMU-School of Social, Sumners Foundation Scholarship, SMU Merit Scholarship Programme (35 awarded annually), Lee Kong Chian Scholarship Programme, Kwa Geok Choo Scholarship, Science and Technology Undergraduate Scholarship, GMC Scholarship, and Wee Kim Wee Scholarship. Approximately 1 in 3 freshmen receive a scholarship or financial award.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application for Academic Year 2026-27 opens on 17 November 2025 and closes on 19 March. Specific scholarships may have different timelines, e.g., Intake 2026 for MOE-START PG scholarship commences 14 Nov 2025, and Annual Scholarships for Study Abroad 2025 deadline is 02 Dec 2025.

basic_info.study_country: U.S.A, Uganda, Ghana, South Africa, Kenya, other African countries

funding_info.funding_details: On average, the program pays for less than 10% of the total costs of a four year Education, with the balance funded by merit based college grants.

timeline_info.application_deadline: April 5th, 2024 (for Kenya applicants); 5 April 2025 (general call for applications)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Academically gifted female students from disadvantaged backgrounds from Africa. Must have an A or A- in KCSE exams (for Kenya applicants) and have undertaken leadership roles in school/community. Must come from a financially disadvantaged background and have completed secondary school examination (KCSE).

academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Leadership role(s) in school and/or community

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: GRE, SAT

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Required (referees named in the application form)
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: From disadvantaged backgrounds; Financially disadvantaged
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Students are required to be partners in this initiative by holding down on-campus jobs to pay for books and incidentals.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application form (downloadable)
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Involves obtaining additional information concerning personal, academic, and financial records; communication and release of information to others involved in decision-making.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A leadership development program founded in 2002 by Dr Susan Mboya, based on the Kennedy-Mboya Africa Student Airlifts Program. Provides university scholarships and leadership development and life skills training to academically gifted but financially disadvantaged African girls, with the objective of developing a pipeline of young African women leaders.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: 2025 Zawadi Africa Call for Applications

basic_info.official_name: Government of Brunei Darussalam Scholarship for International Students 2025/2026
basic_info.provider: Government of Brunei Darussalam (Ministry of Foreign Affairs)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded. This prestigious scholarship provides a monthly allowance, accommodation, and exemption from tuition fees, acceptance fees, and registration fees.

timeline_info.opening_date: Applications are now open for the 2025/2026 academic session

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students, including foreign/international students from OIC Member States.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Various disciplines, including but not limited to engineering, science, humanities. Candidates may pursue studies at participating institutions such as Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD), Kolej Universiti Perguruan Ugama Seri Begawan Islam Sultan Sharif Ali university (UNISSA), Brunei Institute of Technology (ITB), and Politeknik Brunei (PB).

academic_requirements.required_degree: Diploma, Undergraduate Degree, Postgraduate Master’s Degree

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Scholarship recipients are required to conform to all the rules and regulations underlying this scholarship award scheme.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed application forms (details to be attained from official website). Applicants applying to Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD) must also complete an online application through UBD's admission portal.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A prestigious scholarship offered annually under a special scholarship award scheme, providing a unique opportunity for international students to pursue studies at leading institutions in Brunei Darussalam.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship for the 2025/2026 academic session.

funding_info.funding_details: Award amounts are $20,000 for master's students, $25,000 for doctoral degree, and $50,000 for postdoctoral research. Up to five International Master’s/First Professional Degree Fellowships are renewable for a second year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Awarded to women (including people who identify as women) not holding U.S. citizenship or permanent residency for full-time study or research in the United States at an accredited institution of higher education. Emphasizes academic excellence, leadership potential, and commitment to advancing women and girls.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: all fields of study
field_restrictions.restrictions: Some sources suggest focus on education, health/medical sciences, STEM, or social sciences fields.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: minimum cumulative GPA of 3.5 on a 4.0 scale for the highest degree earned.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s/First Professional Degree, Doctoral degree, Postdoctoral research

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS - 6.5. TOEFL iBT - 79. TOEFL Essentials - 8.5. Scores are valid for two years.

additional_requirements.gender_requirement: women (including people who identify as women)
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: commitment to advancing women and girls

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Proof of English proficiency (Official report of an acceptable and valid TOEFL or IELTS score).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Originally designed to provide Latin American women opportunities for graduate and postgraduate study in the U.S., the International Fellowships program awarded its first fellowship in 1917. The program now includes women from around the world, and International Fellowships have been awarded to more than 3,600 women from more than 150 nations.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications open annually on August 1 and close on November 15. The application deadline for AY 2026-2027 is 30 September 2025, 11:59 p.m. Pacific Standard Time.

basic_info.provider: British Council, UK government’s GREAT Britain Campaign, and participating UK higher education institutions

funding_info.funding_details: Each scholarship awards an amount of £10,000, which will be deducted from tuition fees and is tenable for one academic year. Scholarship funding will be issued to successful scholars by individual universities after registration.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by university, with deadlines observed in April-May 2026 (e.g., 8 April 2026, 6 May 2026, 7 May 2026).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 200 worldwide for the 2025/26 academic year, offered by 70 UK universities (e.g., 18 for Turkey, 2 for Robert Gordon University, 1 for University of Leicester).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to students from target countries (e.g., Turkey, Pakistan, China mainland passport holders), who hold an undergraduate degree enabling postgraduate study, meet the English language requirement of the UK university, are willing to maintain contact with the British Council and their university and act as an ambassador for the scholarships, and are applying for a one-year taught postgraduate course/master's degree. Offer holders can apply. Applicants should be active in the field with work experience or a proven interest in the proposed subject area.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Wide range of one-year taught postgraduate courses across various subjects, including any postgraduate courses offered by participating universities.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Limited to one-year taught postgraduate courses or master's degrees.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate degree (to enable postgraduate study); scholarship is for one-year taught postgraduate/master's degrees.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience or a proven interest in the proposed subject area.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Meet the English language requirement of the UK university.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must be citizens of target countries/target country passport holders. Willingness to maintain contact with the British Council and university, and act as an ambassador for the scholarships. Offer holders can apply.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Instructions on how to apply and required documents are available on individual university scholarship webpages.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Shortlisted candidates will be contacted mid-June. Decisions are made by dates such as 8 May 2026 (university-specific). Funding is issued by individual universities after registration.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The GREAT Scholarships programme offers an exceptional opportunity for students from around the world to study in the United Kingdom, supporting postgraduate students to access world-class UK higher education opportunities. Scholars are expected to be ambassadors for their university and the GREAT scholarship program.
