background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships are available for the 2025-26 and 2026-27 academic years. Applications for the 2026-27 academic year open in December 2025, with university-specific deadlines in April-May 2026.

basic_info.provider: Hungarian Government (managed by Tempus Public Foundation)

funding_info.funding_details: A full scholarship offered by the Hungarian Government for almost 80 countries, based upon bilateral governmental agreements. It provides tuition-free education, monthly stipend, accommodation contribution, and medical insurance. Doctoral stipends are HUF 140,000 (cca EUR 365) for the first 4 semesters and HUF 180,000 (cca EUR 470) for the second 4 semesters, for 12 months a year until completion. Accommodation includes a free dormitory place or a contribution of HUF 40,000 / month to the accommodation costs for the whole duration of the scholarship period.
covered_expenses: Housing Assistance (free dormitory or HUF 40,000/month contribution)

timeline_info.opening_date: Application for 2025/2026 academic year has started. Call for Applications for 2026/2027 academic year published, application system opening to be announced.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Offered to citizens of almost 80 countries based on bilateral governmental agreements. Applicants must ensure their chosen program is eligible under the agreement between Hungary and their home country’s sending partner. Applicants are eligible only for scholarship types and study fields determined in these cooperation programs. The scholarship holder must habitually reside in Hungary during the study period. Current Stipendium Hungaricum scholarship holders can reapply for a new study program for the academic year 2026/27. Student status from a sending higher education institution outside of Hungary is not always needed, unless required by the Hungarian host institution.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Varies by educational cooperation programs in effect between Hungary and the specific Sending Partner country.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Varies by educational cooperation programs in effect between Hungary and the specific Sending Partner country.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 56 points on a 100-point scale for 'acceptable' or 'conditionally acceptable' status; outstanding academic performance at previous level of education.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Varies by program (Bachelor's, Master's, One-tier Master's, Doctoral)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Varies by specific study program; language requirements are detailed in program descriptions.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Students at Risk Subprogramme is available.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must ensure program eligibility under bilateral agreements with their home country's sending partner. Scholarship holders must comply with Operational Regulations, including academic progress requirements, and habitually reside in Hungary during studies. Current Stipendium Hungaricum scholarship holders can reapply for a new study program. Student status from a sending higher education institution is not always required, unless specified by the Hungarian host institution.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Required documents are submitted through the online application system (https://apply.stipendiumhungaricum.hu/). Specific documents are detailed in the Call for Applications (e.g., BA_MA_OTM_Call_for_Applications_2026_27.pdf, PhD_Call_for_Applications_2026_27.pdf) and the Application Guide (e.g., Application_Guide_2025_26.pdf).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications are reviewed jointly by the sending partner (in the applicant’s home country) and the Hungarian host institution.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Founded in 2013, with over 90 sending partners. Its core mission is to increase the number of foreign students in Hungary. Nearly 12,000 scholarship holders are currently studying in Hungary. In 2025, 80,000 applications were submitted.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for academic years 2021/2022, 2023/2024, 2024/2025, and 2025/2026 have opened. The Call for Applications for the 2026/2027 academic year has been published, with the application period for 2026/2027 expected in January – February 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: fully-funded scholarships
covered_expenses: Health insurance (Medical Insurance policy with minimum sum assured for Indian Rupees Five Lakhs per annum)
Other expenses related to the academic program

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 640 scholarship slots globally (for Atal Bihari Vajpayee General Scholarship Scheme)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Interested international students; outstanding Vietnamese students; students from Uganda and Burundi are invited to apply.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Wide range of subjects; Indian culture, including dance, music, theatre, performing arts, sculpture, Indian languages, cuisine, and more (Lata Mangeshkar Dance & Music Scholarship Scheme).
field_restrictions.restrictions: Except Medical, Paramedical, Fashion, Law, and 5-year Integrated Courses.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 60% or equivalent.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate, Postgraduate, and Ph.D. programs. For Undergraduate applicants from Uganda: Uganda Certificate of Education – UCE (equivalent to Grade 10) and Uganda Advanced Certificate of Education – UACE (equivalent to Grade 12). For Undergraduate applicants from Burundi: Lower Secondary (4 years equivalent to Grade 10) and Upper Secondary (3 years equivalent to Grade 12).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Minimum score of 6.5 in IELTS or 90 in TOEFL or equivalent, with a good command of English.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two recommendation letters / character certificates.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Applicants should generally be between 18-30 years of age, though some sources indicate eligibility up to 40 years.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Birth certificate OR National ID; Filled up medical fitness form (downloadable from portal); Compulsory to procure Medical Insurance policy with minimum sum assured for Indian Rupees Five Lakhs per annum.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Certified copies of documents showing specific qualifications; Two recommendation letters / character certificates; Birth certificate OR National ID; Filled up medical fitness form.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Students apply via A2A portal. Once admission is obtained and Mission/Post awards scholarship, students register on SII portal for Unique ID, visa, and FRRO registration. Indian Missions confirm admission by 25th of July.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: ICCR scholarship is only for the individual applicant for the duration of the enrolled course in India. Only one course can be pursued.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Portal operational from 20th February 2025. Last date for applicants to apply on the portal is 30 April 2025. Last date for Indian Missions to confirm admission is 25th of July.

basic_info.official_name: Swedish Institute Scholarships for Global Professionals (SISGP)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded opportunity for international students. The program is funded by the Swedish government.
covered_expenses: Tuition fees to the Swedish university
Monthly stipend of SEK 12,000 for living expenses
A one-time travel grant of SEK 10,000-15,000
Membership in the SI Network for Future Global Professionals (NFGP)
Lifelong membership of the SI Alumni Network

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Usually 4-6% of applicants are awarded (approx. 350-351 scholarships per year)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be a citizen of a country eligible for the SI scholarship (from 42 eligible countries) and required to pay international tuition fees. Applicants must be admitted to a master’s programme at a Swedish university that is eligible for the SISGP. Applicants do not need to reside in their home country at the time of application. SI welcomes applicants regardless of age or religious beliefs and aims at diversity and gender equality among scholarship holders.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Eligible master's programmes are published on the official SI website. Funding is provided for approximately 700 English language programs among various master's programs offered by Swedish universities.
field_restrictions.restrictions: No quotas for specific countries, fields of study, or Swedish universities.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 on a scale of 4.0 or equivalent (e.g., 8.2 on Danish 7-point scale or 9 on another scale).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Admission to a master’s level study program in Sweden.

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum of 3,000 hours of demonstrated work experience.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Proof of Work and Leadership Experience.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS, TOEFL, or another accepted English proficiency test result is required, unless otherwise specified.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two Reference Letters are required.
additional_requirements.career_plan: A detailed Motivation Letter/Statement explaining why you are applying for the scholarship and how your studies will contribute to sustainable development in your country or globally.
additional_requirements.age_limits: None specified (applicants welcomed regardless of age).
additional_requirements.gender_requirement: None specified (aims for diversity and gender equality).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Valid Passport/National ID, Proof of application to an eligible master’s program at a Swedish university. Only one scholarship application should be submitted regardless of the number of master's programs applied for at University Admissions, Stockholm School of Economics or Konstfack.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: CV (max 3 pages), Proof of Work and Leadership Experience, Two Reference Letters, Passport/National ID, Motivation Statement/Letter, Admission Proof. All documents must follow the SISGP template form (updated 11/2022).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The SI scholarship is highly competitive. After admissions results are announced by University Admissions (26 March 2026), SI evaluates applications still eligible for the scholarship. The number of recipients from different countries and to certain programmes/universities may differ depending on the quality of applications.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The SI Swedish Institute Scholarships provide a fully funded opportunity for international students from eligible countries to pursue a master’s degree in Sweden.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Mid-November 2025: SI Scholarship application documents and eligible master programmes published. Applications open. 25 February 2026: Application Deadline. 26 March 2026: University Admissions results announced, followed by SI evaluation of eligible scholarship applications.

basic_info.provider: Government of Indonesia / Indonesian Ministry of Education and Culture

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded; all expenses covered.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Prospective international students from developing countries; must be non-Indonesian citizens.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Wide range of fields including engineering, economics, health sciences, social studies, accounting, management, law, pharmacy, chemistry, informatics, and civil engineering.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Specific study programs vary by participating university.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.0 (some sources indicate 3.25) in previous degree.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's, Master's, or Doctoral degrees. Bachelor's degree required for Master's/Doctoral applicants.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work history (if any).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: TOEFL ITP 500, TOEFL IBT 61, IELTS 6.0, TOEIC 575.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation letter from Indonesian Representative (Embassy/Consulate General), employer/immediate supervisor (if working), previous academic institutions, and potential research supervisor (for doctoral applicants).
additional_requirements.age_limits: Maximum age: 21 for Bachelor's, 35 for Master's, 40 for PhD.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Official Passport valid until at least December 31, 2026; cannot register without a recommendation letter from the Indonesian Representative; must sign letter of statement and scholarship agreement; must have a completed degree in related fields.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Official Passport, Final Diploma, Academic Certificate and Transcript from previous degree, English Proficiency Test Score certificate.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selection process for 2025 was Feb 17 - March 7, with results announced June 13. Results are broadcast online via KNB Scholarship Website and Indonesian Embassy publication network.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Prestigious fully funded program, part of Indonesia’s South-South Partnership global cooperation efforts. Aims to support internationalization and quality improvement of Indonesian higher education. Program has been running since 1993.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: For 2025 cycle: Selection process Feb 17 - March 7; results announced June 13.

basic_info.official_name: University of New South Wales International Scholarships

funding_info.funding_details: A diverse portfolio of scholarships offering vital financial support, ranging from partial tuition fee waivers to full scholarships. Specific awards mentioned include: International Scientia Coursework Scholarship (Offer 1: Full tuition fee scholarship paid directly towards tuition fees for the minimum duration of program; Offer 2: $20,000 per annum paid directly towards tuition fees for the minimum duration of program); International Student Award (15% toward tuition fees for every year of your program); UNSW Business School International Scholarship ($5,000 paid directly towards tuition fees for the minimum duration of program).

timeline_info.application_deadline: 15 July 2025 (for International Scientia Coursework Scholarship and some Term 3, 2025 offers); 30 October 2025 (for Term 1, 2026 intake scholarships)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 20 University-wide Scholarships (for International Scientia Coursework Scholarship); estimated less than 10 per term for other scholarships.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Must be an international student. Must hold an offer of admission into an eligible program at UNSW. Must be commencing full-time study in an eligible undergraduate or postgraduate coursework degree program at UNSW. For Term 3, 2025 intake, an offer of admission by 15 July 2025 is required for some scholarships (e.g., Business School). Students completing UNSW College Foundation Studies or Global Diploma Program prior to commencing an undergraduate program are not eligible for some awards. Must not hold another scholarship or reduced fee arrangement. Students may need to be enrolled in the UNSW Institute of Languages and successfully complete the program prior to commencing studies (for Undergraduate Conditional English Package Offer - UEEC).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Law & Justice, Business, Engineering, Arts, Design & Architecture. Eligible undergraduate or postgraduate coursework degree programs offered by UNSW Business School.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Excluding UNSW online and UNSW Canberra programs. For UNSW Business School International Scholarship, excluding those offered by AGSM.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: At least 60% GPA (Australian standard equivalent). High academic achievement is generally required, especially for prestigious awards like the International Scientia Coursework Scholarship.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate and postgraduate coursework students. Some scholarships are specifically for students who have successfully completed an undergraduate program and are continuing to a postgraduate program at UNSW.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Leadership skills demonstrated at their school, workplace or in their community, and extracurricular activities like sports, cultural activities, volunteer work or work experience.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Students may need to be enrolled in the UNSW Institute of Languages and successfully complete the program prior to commencing studies (for UEEC), implying English proficiency is required.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two references are required to support the application. One referee must be an advisor from the International Programs Office or equivalent officer.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: UNSW offers specific scholarships for Asylum Seekers and Refugee Students.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Not be in receipt of the UNSW Business School International Pathways Award (PUCA1023) for the UNSW Business School International Scholarship.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application form (e.g., for International Scientia Coursework Scholarship). Two references.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Eligible students who have received an offer of admission for Term 3, 2025 may be automatically considered for some scholarships. UNSW Scholarships will email a formal offer letter within 2 business days with further details.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A comprehensive suite of scholarships and awards for international undergraduate and postgraduate coursework students. Key scholarships include the International Scientia Coursework Scholarship (flagship award for high-achieving students), International Student Award, and UNSW Business School International Scholarship.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships are available for various intakes, including Term 3, 2025 and Term 1, 2026. Application deadlines vary by scholarship and intake term, with key dates being 15 July 2025 and 30 October 2025. Applications for Term 1, 2026 intake open on 1 August 2025.

funding_info.funding_details: $50,000 per year for three years

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Up to 166 scholarships awarded annually, divided among three federal granting agencies (CIHR, NSERC, SSHRC), each offering 55 awards annually.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Supports doctoral-level studies (PhD or combined MA/PhD, MSc/PhD, MD/PhD, DVM/PhD, JD/PhD, MBA/PhD) at eligible Canadian universities. Open to both Canadian and international students. Candidates must be nominated by only one Canadian institution with a Vanier CGS quota; direct applications are not accepted. Must be pursuing their first doctoral degree (only PhD portion eligible for joint programs). Must intend to pursue full-time doctoral studies at the nominating institution. Must not hold a faculty appointment concurrently unless on leave. Must remain enrolled and demonstrate satisfactory progress. Must have completed no more than 20 months of doctoral studies by May 1, 2024 (if starting after master's) or no more than 32 months of full-time study in their doctoral program by May 1, 2024 (for joint programs). Not required to be registered or admitted at time of application. Application is via ResearchNet for CIHR, NSERC, and SSHRC.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Health research (CIHR), Natural sciences and/or engineering (NSERC), Social sciences and humanities (SSHRC)

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Must have achieved a first-class average in each of the last two years of full-time study or its equivalent. Specific GPA requirements vary by institution (e.g., minimum 3.0, at least 3.5 on U of A scale, at least 4.0).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Doctoral-level studies (PhD or combined MA/PhD, MSc/PhD, MD/PhD, DVM/PhD, JD/PhD, MBA/PhD)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience, community engagement, awards, publications, and other activities demonstrating leadership.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: No specific language test required by Vanier itself, but candidates must possess sufficient language proficiency, and the host university may require a language test (e.g., DET).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Leadership Reference Letters
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must demonstrate academic excellence, research potential, and leadership skills.

application_documents: Nomination letter (signed by the department head)
Vanier CGS electronic application through ResearchNet
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Candidates cannot apply directly; they must be nominated by a Canadian institution with a Vanier CGS quota. The candidate informs the faculty of graduate studies at the selected university of their intent to apply. After completing the electronic application via ResearchNet, students submit it to the nominating Canadian university. The university's scholarship liaison officer coordinates the review of selected candidates and forwards nominations for Vanier CGSs to the appropriate federal research granting agencies (CIHR, NSERC, SSHRC) according to the university's allocation. Up to 166 scholars are awarded annually, divided among the three federal granting agencies.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Vanier Canada Graduate Scholarships (Vanier CGS) program, started in 2008 by the Government of Canada, supports doctoral-level studies at Canadian universities to attract and retain world-class doctoral students and establish Canada as a global centre of excellence in research and higher learning. The program helps Canadian institutions attract highly qualified doctoral students. The official website states that applications are no longer being accepted for the Vanier Canada Graduate Scholarships, and refers to the Canada Graduate Research Scholarship - Doctoral program as the new harmonized program, effective for the fall 2025 competition.

basic_info.official_name: Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES)

funding_info.funding_details: €10,000 stipend for one year of full-time study

timeline_info.opening_date: Now open for applications for the 2025/26 academic year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Supports high-calibre international students (non-EU/EEA). Applicants must have a conditional or final offer of admission to a full-time NFQ Level 9 or 10 program (Master's, Postgraduate Diploma, or PhD) at an eligible Irish higher education institution at the time of applying. Must not have previously received a GOI-IES scholarship. Applicants should demonstrate academic excellence, leadership potential, and a commitment to global engagement. Must meet all entry requirements for their chosen program, including academic and English language requirements.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any field of study available at chosen universities

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale in their undergraduate degree (or equivalent outstanding academic record)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s, Postgraduate Diploma, or PhD (NFQ levels 9 or 10)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Relevant work experience

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English Language Requirements (specific tests/scores not detailed, but required as part of university entry requirements)

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Required (Guidance for Referees document available)
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Commitment to global engagement, leadership potential, carefully prepared application demonstrating academic excellence and alignment with scholarship goals.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Conditional or final offer of admission, 2025 Call document, FAQs, Selection Process Infographic, Guidance for Referees, Application Help Document.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Details not provided in content, but a 'Selection Process Infographic' is available on the official website.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Prestigious, fully funded program supporting high-calibre international (non-EU/EEA) students, reflecting Ireland's engagement in target partner countries.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: One year of full-time study. Successful candidates expected to commence studies in September or October 2025.

funding_info.funding_details: Undergraduate: 18,000 RMB/year; Master's: 30,000 RMB/year; Doctoral: 30,000 RMB/year. General scholarship budget: 40,000 RMB/year or 30,000-50,000 CNY. Monthly allowance: 1500 RMB/month. Scholarship coverage can include tuition fee reduction.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Variable by university/year: May 31, 2025; April 15; July 15, 2025; July 10, 2025; July 12, 2026.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students and exchange scholars. Applicants should be excellent foreign students with bright academic performance, who want to study in universities and colleges of Jiangsu province. Students studying in student-exchange programs between the government of Jiangsu province and worldwide companies or other Chinese provinces are also eligible. Applicants must respect the laws of China and meet the requirements to enter universities or colleges. Scholarship recipients are selected based on their academic performance.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All Fields

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Strong academic background, typically with outstanding academic performance in previous studies.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Scholarships are available for undergraduate, vocational tertiary, master's, and doctoral studies. Applicants for master degree studies must have a bachelor's degree. Applicants for Doctoral degree studies must have a master's degree.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Students applying for graduate programs should provide 2 recommendation letters in Chinese or English languages from professors or associate professors with contacts.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Applicants for master degree studies must be under the age of 35.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must respect the laws of China and meet the requirements to enter universities or colleges.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online Application Form, uploaded e-documents, 2 recommendation letters (for graduate programs).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Scholarship recipients are selected based on their academic performance. Review type: Strict deadline; not on rolling basis.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: This scholarship is established by Jiangsu Provincial Government to encourage outstanding international students to study in Jiangsu. It offers a unique opportunity for international students and exchange scholars to pursue various degree levels in the best universities and colleges in Jiangsu province. Both full and partial scholarships are available.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Opening Date: Generally in March; Closing Date: Typically in May (check for annual updates); Review Type: Strict deadline; not on rolling basis.

basic_info.provider: Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA) of Romania

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded opportunities for international students from non-EU countries to pursue Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD studies in Romania.
covered_expenses: monthly stipend for students studying in the Romanian language preparatory year

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 85 scholarships for under- and post-graduate studies

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International students from non-EU countries; Must not already hold a Romanian state scholarship for the same study cycle; Not eligible if citizen of Romanian origins and members of any Romanian historical community in the nearness of Romania.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Education Sciences, political and administrative sciences, education studies
field_restrictions.restrictions: except Medicine, Dental, Pharmacy

academic_requirements.min_gpa: minimum GPA of 7/10 (on the Romanian grading scale) or its equivalent
academic_requirements.required_degree: High school diploma for Bachelor's; Bachelor's degree for Master's; Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD programs

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: For candidates who do not speak Romanian, a preparatory year is granted for the study of the Romanian language prior to the actual university studies, with the exception of doctoral scholarship holders who have opted for the form of education in a foreign language set by the doctoral school.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two reference letters (Masters)
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must demonstrate strong academic performance, with good grades.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Passport; Birth Certificate (English); Academic Papers; Two reference letters (Masters); Applicant's CV (Europus format); Statement of (incomplete); Completed application form; Copies of Educational certificates (SSC, HSC, Bachelor's, Master's, PhD if applicable) with authorized translation; Copy of the certificate proving that the person in the final year of studies is to take the graduation exam at the end of the school/university year and the authorized translation into English, French, Spanish or Romanian, if applicable; A duly filled in MFA application form (Annex 1) for a scholarship to study in Romania.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Upon Letter of Acceptance, the candidate will contact the Romanian embassy.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Romania Government Scholarships provide fully funded opportunities for international students from non-EU countries to pursue Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD studies in Romania, enabling scholars to gain a world-class education in a wide range of fields.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2025-2026 Government of Romania Scholarship for International Students are now open for applications. Applications for the Romanian Government Scholarship will be open to undergraduate and graduate students for the academic year 2025. Applications must be submitted online between 29 January 2025 and 12 March 2025 through the official Study In Romania scholarship platform.

basic_info.official_name: Open Doors Russian Government Scholarship Project
basic_info.provider: Association of Global Universities with the support of the Russian Government

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship covers tuition fees. Dormitory fees (approx. 13,500 Rubles or Rs. 48,000 per month) are not covered, nor are communication expenses, stationery, everyday purchases, and incidental costs (roughly 150 dollars).
covered_expenses: Early admission to any Russian university without entrance examinations

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students / talented students from foreign countries.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Psychology, Economics, Neuroscience & Psychology, Economics & Econometrics, Artificial Intelligence, Business, Engineering, Medicine, Political Science, Russian Language and Culture, and many more (any major).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 3.5 GPA is essential (Note: 2.7 GPA was mentioned for the 2024 program).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s Track: Bachelor’s degree or final year of undergraduate studies. PhD Track: Master’s degree or final year of graduate studies. Also open for Bachelor's programs.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Training is offered in both English and Russian, implying no language barrier or specific formal certificate requirement mentioned.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: If chosen as a winner by both Rossotrudnichestvo and Open Doors, you must choose between the two scholarships; you cannot get both.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Statement of purpose or motivational letter. Pass an online exam or assessment in their field of study.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Statement of purpose or motivational letter, Two letters of recommendation. (Further required documents for Bachelors, Masters, and PhD are mentioned but not listed).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Fully online application in several stages. Stage 1 (Portfolio) and Stage 2 (Exams/Interview). Applicants need to pass an online exam or assessment in their field of study.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: One of the most prestigious scholarships in Russia for international students. Allows tuition-free study at over 24 leading Russian universities. Winners gain access to world-class education and research opportunities. Offers early admission without entrance examinations and the opportunity to choose a university and degree program through a streamlined one-stop system. Provides an engaging student life experience, vibrant campus environment, and ongoing support.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application opens around August 12th. Application deadline is November 16, 2025 for the 2026-27 academic year. Results for the 2024 program were released on December 25, 2024 (no results date for 2026-27 provided).

funding_info.funding_details: Two types of scholarships: Category A (Full Scholarship) and Category B. Category A covers full expenses.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by university. General period: February to April annually. Specific deadlines mentioned: February 15th, 2025 (Shanghai University); March 1st, 2025 (ECNU First Batch); May 15th, 2025 (ECNU Second Batch); August 15th (for Bachelor programs); July 15th, 2024 (Sanda University).
timeline_info.opening_date: Varies by university. General period: February annually. Specific opening date mentioned: March 1st (for Bachelor programs).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be excellent international students (non-Chinese citizens) in pursuit of degrees. Must be in good health and have no criminal record. Well performed both academically and behaviorally. Must adhere to specific criteria set by the universities.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Category I includes: Philosophy, Economics, Law, Education, Literature, History. Programs available at Undergraduate, Master's, and PhD levels.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Specific GPA requirements apply for Science or Engineering programs.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 3.0/4.0 or 80/100 (for high school diploma, undergraduate programs, Science/Engineering programs). Master's: Bachelor's degree with a GPA of 2.5 or above. Doctoral: Master's degree with a GPA (value not specified).
academic_requirements.required_degree: High school diploma (for undergraduate/pre-college), Bachelor's degree (for Master's), Master's degree (for Doctoral).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: HSK 4+ (valid within 2 years) or HSK 5:180. IELTS 6.0 / TOEFL 80 or Attestation letter. Native Chinese speakers or applicants who completed previous studies in Chinese may be exempted from HSK certificates upon university approval. Note: One source states 'no IELTS required'.

additional_requirements.age_limits: Under 25 years old (general, for high school degree holders/Bachelor). Under 23 years old (for pre-college program). Aged 18-25 (for SUFE). Under 40 years old (for doctoral program). A general range of 25-40 is also mentioned.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants cannot be the holders of any other kinds of Chinese government scholarship.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Non-Chinese citizens. Awarded based on merit. No application fee (mentioned by one source). Letter of pre-admission of the undergraduate program by a Shanghai university (for pre-college program).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application form for Shanghai Government Scholarship. Application Form for Shanghai Government Scholarship (filled in Chinese or English). Highest diploma (notarized photocopy). Studying certificates from the university or working certificates from the company (if applicable). Shanghai Municipal Government Scholarship for Foreign Students application guide. List of universities accepting Shanghai Municipal Government Scholarship for Foreign Students.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Excellent opportunity for international students to study in China. Undergraduate, master’s, and PhD programmes available at top Shanghai universities. Funded by the Shanghai Government. 31 universities in Shanghai participate in the SGS scholarship program. Established since 2006. Classified for international students.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application Process, Eligibility Requirements, Step-by-Step Application Procedure.

basic_info.provider: Government of Kazakhstan (administered by Joint Stock Company and National Center for the Development of Higher Education)
basic_info.study_country: Kazakhstan (for international students); Abroad (for Kazakh citizens)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship covering tuition fees, book allowances, living, travel, and visa expenses, and providing a monthly allowance of USD 2,000 per student.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students (foreign nationals, including individuals of Kazakh ethnicity who are not citizens of Kazakhstan) for study in Kazakhstan, and to citizens of the Republic of Kazakhstan for study abroad. Applicants must apply for a Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD program and demonstrate a strong academic background with relevant qualifications.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Science, economics, engineering, public policy, medicine, and other major fields.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.0/4.0 for Master's and PhD applicants (some sources state 2.33/4.0 for Master's/PhD). For Bachelor's degree diploma, a minimum GPA of 3.0/4.0 is required.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD degree. Master's applicants require a Bachelor's degree diploma. PhD applicants require both a Bachelor's and Master's degree.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: One or more letters of recommendation (academic reference from university/institution).
additional_requirements.career_plan: A brief proposal or expression of interest.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Invitation letter from a Kazakh university (if available) for Bachelor's applicants. Recipients are required to work in Kazakhstan in their field of study upon completion of their degree.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application form (in English, Kazakh, or Russian), updated CV with a photo, letter(s) of recommendation, expression of interest/brief proposal, identity document (Tazkira), Bachelor's degree diploma and transcript (with notarized translation into Kazakh, Russian, or English), Master's degree diploma and transcript (with notarized translation into Kazakh, Russian, or English for PhD applicants), invitation letter from a Kazakh university (if available for Bachelor's applicants).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Initial review of applications for eligibility, followed by online interviews for shortlisted applicants with representatives from the Ministry of Science and Higher Education, the Operator, and universities.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established by the President of the Republic of Kazakhstan, it is the flagship scholarship program designed to train the country's future leaders and fund bright young Kazakhs to study abroad, as well as international students to study in Kazakhstan.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications open on March 30, 2025, with a deadline of May 31, 2025 (some sources indicate June 30).

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded. Fully covers tuition fees of selected Master’s study programs and provides subsidies for health insurance and living expenses in Czechia. Covers almost all expenses a student might incur while studying abroad.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International students from selected developing countries. Applicants must meet academic merit and health requirements. Willingness to study in Czech or English.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s or PhD degree programs. Specifically mentioned: Master in Economics and Finance (MEF) or the Master in Finance and Data Analytics (MFDA) at the Faculty of Social Sciences. A full list of eligible study programs is not provided in the scraped content.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Available exclusively to citizens of eligible developing countries. Explicitly mentioned: Bosnia and Herzegovina, Georgia, Ukraine, Belarus (Democratic Forces). A full list of eligible countries is not provided in the scraped content.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's applicants must already possess at least a Bachelor's degree. PhD candidates should already have both a Bachelor's and a Master's degree.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English-taught programs usually require IELTS/TOEFL scores. Czech-taught programs require a Czech language preparatory. Foreign candidates must demonstrate English language proficiency by submitting IELTS test results (minimum score of 5.5–6.5, depending on the program) or TOEFL.

additional_requirements.career_plan: Be ready to explain your study and career path during visa interview. Motivation letter should show academic goals, future plans, and your country's need for your expertise.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Typically under 35 (varies by program). Age limit and other criteria may apply depending on the program.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Affirmation on Return to the Country of Origin upon Completion of Studies. Highlight academic excellence and achievements.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed online application form; Guidelines and FAQ's (to read); Application Form for a Scholarship of the Government of the Czech Republic; CV with a focus on studies and employment/resume; Photocopy of passport (if issued); Declaration about the Acceptance of the Terms and Conditions Governing the Granting of Scholarships (Annex No. 1); Declaration about the Acceptance of the Terms and Conditions Governing the Provision of Health Services (Annex No. 2); Affirmation on Return to the Country of Origin upon Completion of Studies (Annex No. 3); Legalised copy of birth certificate with certified translation into Czech; Medical confirmation about the applicant’s health (no more than two months old) with certified translation into English or Czech (Annex No. 4); Legalised copy of a foreign diploma or similar document proving due completion of a Follow-up Master’s Study programme with certified translation into Czech (for Doctoral); Legalised copy of a Diploma Supplement or list of completed subjects and examinations including their scope and grades (marks) achieved with certified translation into Czech (for Doctoral); Motivation Letter; IELTS/TOEFL test results (if applicable).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Awarded competitively to outstanding applicants. Visa interview may require explanation of study and career path.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Since the 1950s, over 20 thousand foreign nationals have completed their studies in Czech using this scholarship award. Duration: Up to 3 years for Master's degree programs and up to 4 years for PhD degree programs.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Academic Year 2026/27

funding_info.funding_details: Covers tuition fees fully or partially (Half/A quarter of tuition fee of one-academic year for partial scholarship). Scholarship duration is for the candidate's program (less than four years for bachelor’s, master’s, post-doctoral degrees; less than one year for special education, language studies, or exchange programs).

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by university and year. Examples include: June 6th, 2025 (Beijing Language and Culture University - BLCU); May 30th each year (University of International Business and Economics - UIBE). General guidance suggests deadlines by June 30th or end of February. Applicants should consult relevant Higher Education Institutions (HEIs) for specific deadlines.
timeline_info.opening_date: Varies by university. Examples include: February 1st of each year (UIBE). Generally, applications are 'currently open' at various times.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to Non-Chinese citizens. Applicants should be international students. Must be admitted as an undergraduate or graduate student at a participating university (e.g., Peking University - PKU, Beijing Normal University - BNU, China Agricultural University - CAU) and pursue a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD degree. Excellent current international students are also eligible (e.g., BNU).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: For China Agricultural University (CAU): average score of at least 80/100 or a GPA of 3.0 for prospective students. For current students applying, the average score of the previous academic year must be no less than 80/100. Academic achievements and overall quality are assessed (BNU).
academic_requirements.required_degree: High school graduate (for undergraduate programs). Bachelor’s, Master’s, PhD, and Post-doctoral degrees are eligible study levels. Students admitted to Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD degree programs.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: For English-taught majors (China University of Petroleum - CUP): IELTS 6.0, TOEFL 75 or above, or equivalent proof. Exceptions for applicants from countries whose official language is English. For Chinese-taught majors (CUP): HSK-4 level (222 or above) for undergraduate programs, HSK-5 level or above for postgraduate programs. Chinese proficiency test scores are not required for English-taught programs (CAU).

additional_requirements.age_limits: Under the age of 25 when applying for undergraduate programs (CUP).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must not be receiving other tuition scholarship funds.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application form for Beijing Government Scholarship. Necessary documents to be uploaded (CAU). Application materials mentioned in the Admission Brochure (BNU).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The International Students’ Office (PKU) is authorized to be responsible for the acceptance, review, and approval of applications. BNU's Assessment Committee is responsible for the assessment and award along with the administration of the project.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established by Beijing Municipal Government to encourage and support excellent international students looking for further education in Beijing. Needs to be applied for every year. Consult relevant Higher Education Institutions (HEIs) for specific application deadlines.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship results will be announced in August 2025 (BLCU).

basic_info.provider: Ministry of Education and Higher Education in Qatar; Qatar University; Education Above All Foundation; Texas A&M University in Qatar; University of Calgary in Qatar; Georgetown University in Qatar

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded. These fully financed scholarships cover all expenses related to tuition fees, accommodation, and other educational costs.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Government Scholarships: September 30, 2025; Qatar University Bachelors Scholarships 2026: 22 October 2025; General Round 2: 15 April 2026 (for same year commencement); Education Above All: follows individual university admissions timelines.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Qatari students and other qualified applicants; international applicants for undergraduate programs; academically distinguished students; undergraduate non-Qatari students (including international students) talented in scientific research, technology and innovation, literature, acting for male, media, and athleticism; eligible non-Qatari students living in Qatar who have studied in Qatar for at least eight years; Doha-born students; full-time student who has completed one year of study at a branch campus. Not eligible for Qatar University academic scholarships: Students who transfer from other universities to Qatar University, visiting students, non-degree applicants and applicants seeking a second bachelor's degree.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Approved list of universities and academic disciplines; scientific research, technology and innovation, literature, acting for male, media, and athleticism (for specific QU scholarship); Arabic Program for Non-Native speakers.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Students must select from the list of universities and academic disciplines officially recognized and approved under the scholarship scheme.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 80% average in high school (or foundation year) for bachelor's scholarships; required GPA in major; at least a 3.0 cumulative GPA (Texas A&M); Minimum high school average of 85% or higher (UCalgary); Minimum Nursing Diploma GPA of 3.30 or higher (UCalgary); Minimum transfer GPA of 3.30 or higher on at least 8 half courses (UCalgary); minimum overall GPA of 3.8 (Georgetown Qatar).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate programs; Bachelors, Masters, PhD, Diploma; higher education.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: No IELTS or TOEFL required for Qatar University awards. Arabic Program for Non-Native speakers may require language proficiency assessment.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two reference letters from reputable sources (for QU); Recommendation Letter (for Arabic Program for Non-Native speakers).
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Non-Qatari students living in Qatar who have studied in Qatar for at least eight years (for EAA/UDST); Doha-born students (for government scholarships expansion).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Completed scholarship application form; Copy of Qatari ID and passport; Official transcripts and academic certificates.

background_and_logistics.official_website: scholarship.edu.gov.qa (for Government Scholarships); qu.edu.qa/en-us/students/admission/scholarships/Pages/types.aspx (for Qatar University); educationaboveall.org/our-work/our-projects/qatar-scholarship-programme-residents-qatar (for Education Above All Foundation).
background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed scholarship application form; Copy of Qatari ID and passport; Official transcripts and academic certificates; two reference letters from reputable sources; Recommendation Letter (for Arabic Program for Non-Native speakers).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Top fully funded programs offered by the Qatari government, leading universities, and key partners. The 2026–2027 Government Scholarship Plan offers three main programs: Amiri Scholarship, Abroad Scholarship, and Local Scholarship (including professional diplomas). Qatar University scholarships receive over 5,000 applications annually, making competition fierce.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2026–2027 Government Scholarship Programs are now officially open. The Qatar Scholarship Programme follows the individual admissions timelines of each university.

basic_info.official_name: HKSAR Belt and Road Scholarship (HKSAR GSF – Outstanding Performance)
basic_info.provider: HKSAR Government Scholarship Fund / Hong Kong Government

funding_info.funding_details: A fully funded scholarship program providing comprehensive financial support. For sub-degree students, the award is between HK$20,000 and HK$30,000 for both local and non-local students. For general HKSAR Government Scholarship, the amount is HK$40,000 per year for local students and HK$80,000 per year for non-local students. For CityU's Belt & Road Scholarship (Designated Countries) for UGC-funded undergraduate programmes, it is HK$160,000 covering annual tuition fees. For CityU's Belt & Road Scholarship (Research Postgraduate), it covers the normative study period (up to two years for MPhil, up to three years for PhD with MPhil, and up to four years for PhD without MPhil).
covered_expenses: Tuition fees (specifically for CityU undergraduate Belt & Road Scholarship)

Other partial scholarships can cover up to 75% of tuition fees, with some sources indicating up to 100% tuition coverage. Under the new benefits scheme for Bachelor, Master’s, and PhD students, some tiers (e.g., Tier II) may include a monthly stipend of 10,000 AED, subject to approval and meeting progression criteria.

The average Amherst financial aid package is $70,081.

It amounts to $176,000 over the course of 4 years, providing 100% funding for all enrolled international students in their first year of study and generally for 4 full years.

funding_info.funding_details: Princeton University offers a comprehensive need-based financial aid program, replacing student loans with grants for all aid recipients since 2001, allowing undergraduates to graduate with little to no debt. The program applies the same policy to international students. Most families with income under $100,000 qualify for grant aid covering full tuition, room, books, and personal expenses. Families with incomes up to $150,000 may pay nothing, and many families with incomes up to $250,000 (and even beyond $350,000 for those with multiple children in college) receive grant aid covering full tuition. Graduate students (Ph.D. and many master's) receive financial support through University fellowships, assistantships, or non-University awards. Aid is available for approved study abroad programs, covering tuition, housing, travel, meals, and reasonable program-related expenses (e.g., personal expenses, airfare, books, visa-related costs). Federal aid is applied no earlier than 10 days prior to a semester, and institutional aid as early as 60 days prior. Students receiving term-time aid are also eligible for comparable support for Princeton summer courses. The University considers all financial assistance from outside scholarships or other third-party funding and the expected family contribution before offering federal and institutional need-based aid. Princeton Parent Loans (PPL) are available for families to finance their share of costs.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Princeton's financial aid is strictly need-based, not merit or athletic. Eligibility is determined by family financial need. Most families with incomes under $100,000 qualify for full grant aid. Families with incomes up to $150,000 may pay nothing, and many families with incomes up to $250,000 (and even beyond $350,000 for those with multiple children in college) receive grant aid. International students must demonstrate top grades and a strong need for aid, with Princeton considering grades and extracurricular activities. The university aims for at least 22% of undergraduates to be Pell Grant eligible. For aid determination, Princeton reviews financial information from two parents and considers the independent student's household income and assets if applicable. Aid is available for first-year applicants, current undergraduates (Class of 2026, 2027, 2028, 2029), and Ph.D. and many master's degree candidates.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must apply via Princeton's portal, complete the Princeton Financial Aid Application (PFAA), and submit required documents. For single-choice early action applicants, there is a restriction against applying to an early program at any other private college or university within the United States.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Princeton Financial Aid Application (PFAA), FAFSA, required documents, forms, household income and assets information (including spouse if applicable), two parents' financial information.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Financial aid is need-based. The Princeton Office of Financial Aid determines an applicant's needs for tuition assistance based on family financial information. The University considers all financial assistance from outside scholarships or other third-party funding and the expected family contribution before offering federal and institutional need-based aid. For study abroad, the Office of International Programs (OIP) reviews and approves budget figures before forwarding them to the financial aid office. For international students, grades and extracurricular activities are considered in addition to financial need.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Princeton University Financial Aid is a comprehensive, need-based program that has replaced student loans with grants since 2001, aiming for graduates to incur little to no debt. It applies the same generous financial aid policy to international students as to domestic students. The undergraduate financial aid budget for 2022-23 was $217.4 million. Princeton is recognized as a #1 Private Best Value College and aims for at least 22% Pell Grant eligible undergraduates. Financial support is also provided for Ph.D. and many master's degree candidates.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The application deadline for the Princeton Financial Aid Application (PFAA) is May 1, 2026. The FAFSA application deadline is March 1, 2026, with FAFSA opening in mid-November. Single-choice early action admission applications are due November 1.

Six selected Woodruff scholars will receive a four-year scholarship up to $5,000 per year, covering tuition and fees.

Must select one of the three admission decision plans (Early Decision I, Early Decision II, or Regular Decision). Participation in an interview is required. Required to attend Emory University.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Emory University’s Scholar Programs provide exceptional programming, specialized resources, and an unparalleled support network of peers, faculty, staff, and alumni. These are merit-based scholarships for exceptional incoming first-year students.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application deadline is November 15 (November 1 for ED I). Finalist notification by March 1.

funding_info.funding_details: Dartmouth's financial aid covers 100% of the demonstrated need of all its students. Need-based financial aid eligibility is based on the total cost of education and the family's ability to pay. Demonstrated need is met with a combination of student employment, and scholarship or grants. Students from low- to middle-income backgrounds (families with total annual income below $125,000 and typical assets) can expect a financial aid package with no parent contribution. Students receiving need-based aid will have no expectation to borrow a student loan. A typical financial aid offer for a family with a zero Expected Parent Contribution (EPC) includes student employment of $2,450, Federal and state grants, and Dartmouth scholarship assistance. QuestBridge Match Scholars receive robust financial aid, including off-sets for increases in attendance costs, for their sophomore through senior years. Over $135 million in scholarships have been awarded, with the average scholarship for the Class of 2025 being over $62,500. The average award for the Class of 2028 first-year class is $71,582.
covered_expenses: off-sets for increases in attendance costs

timeline_info.application_deadline: Early Decision: November 1; Regular Decision: February 1; Transfer: March 1
timeline_info.opening_date: FAFSA available October 1; Dartmouth financial aid application available late 2025 (for 2026-2027 academic year)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: The number of awards provided varies annually. 50.8% of the first-year class (Class of 2028) received scholarship aid. 59% of undergraduate students receive financial aid.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Need-based eligibility is determined by the total cost of education and the family's ability to pay. Applicants must complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA®) form. For the 2026-2027 academic year, applicants must submit tax returns and documents for 2024. Families with a total annual income below $125,000 (with typical assets) may qualify for a financial aid package with no parent contribution. Primarily for undergraduate students.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.9 or higher
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: QuestBridge Match admission candidates may qualify for an Expected Parent Contribution (EPC) of zero.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Submission of 2024 tax returns and documents for 2026-2027 academic year application.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA®) form, 2024 tax returns and documents, Financial Aid Materials.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Financial aid officers calculate need and eligibility based on costs and provided information.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Dartmouth College Financial Aid is a need-based program covering 100% of demonstrated need for all students. It aims to ensure affordability for low- to middle-income families by eliminating parent contributions for those below $125,000 annual income (with typical assets) and removing student loan expectations for all aid recipients. The average scholarship for the Class of 2025 was over $62,500, and for the Class of 2028 first-year class, it was $71,582. Over half of undergraduate students receive this aid.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: FAFSA is available October 1. The Dartmouth financial aid application for 2026-2027 will be available in late 2025. Deadlines are November 1 for Early Decision, February 1 for Regular Decision, and March 1 for Transfer applicants. Applicants for 2026-2027 must submit 2024 tax returns and documents.

funding_info.funding_details: A full-tuition scholarship, valued at approximately $260,000 - $276,000. It covers full-time enrollment in 12-18 units for the Fall and Spring semesters. The total dollars awarded for this scholarship is $27,600,000.
covered_expenses: full-time enrollment in 12-18 units for the Fall and Spring semesters

timeline_info.application_deadline: November 1 or December 1, depending on the intended major. Students committed to enrolling in the Marshall School of Business should apply by November 1. Other applicants should apply by December 1.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Merit-based scholarship for undergraduate studies at USC, awarded based on academic excellence, leadership, service, and talent. Candidates are selected by USC. A need-based financial aid application is not required for consideration.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Candidates are selected by USC.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Awarded every year and is renewable.

funding_info.funding_details: MIT Scholarships are need-based scholarships directly from MIT, awarded solely based on financial need, not academic merit. MIT maintains a need-blind admissions policy for all applicants, including international students. The Institute's undergraduate financial aid ensures an MIT education is accessible regardless of financial circumstances, meeting the yearly cost of attendance based on a family’s demonstrated financial need. These are grants that do not need to be repaid. Approximately 58-60% of undergraduates receive MIT Scholarships. For the 2023–2024 academic year, the median MIT Scholarship for undergraduates with need was $66,663, and the Institute awarded $158.2 million in MIT Scholarships. Every year, MIT awards over $165 million in financial aid. The estimated cost of attendance for the 2025–2026 academic year is $84,768. Students are expected to contribute $2,000 from summer work towards their total cost of attendance, and there is a Federal Work-Study requirement of $3,400 that can be used towards personal expenses. The First Year Grant of $2,000 is divided equally between the fall and spring semesters. Outside awards that exceed the student contribution will reduce the MIT Scholarship. (Note: The MIT Scholars program for the Master of Information Technology degree provides an average of $2000 per spring or fall term for tuition and fees.)
covered_expenses: Tuition and fees (for specific VT-MIT Scholars program)

timeline_info.application_deadline: Early Action applicants: November 30; Regular Action and transfer applicants: February 15; Continuing students: February 15. Graduate financial aid application deadlines typically fall between October 1 and May 1 of any given year. (Note: MIT Summer Research Program has a deadline of January 20, 2026).
timeline_info.opening_date: MIT Summer Research Program: September 26, 2025. (General financial aid application opening date not explicitly stated, but the first-year application is open in the MIT application portal).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 58-60% of undergraduates receive MIT Scholarships annually.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: All students who apply for financial aid and fill out the CSS Profile are automatically considered for MIT Scholarships. Eligibility is based entirely on a family’s demonstrated financial need. All international undergraduate applicants are eligible to apply for financial aid at MIT. For the VT-MIT Scholars program, students must be in their first fall or spring term of study, enrolled in at least six MIT credits, and their enrollment should bring unique attributes or experiences to the VT-MIT program and/or IT industry. For the Toigo MBA Fellowship (a specific fellowship), applicants must be planning to pursue a career in finance, be applying to or accepted into an accredited U.S.-based two-year full-time MBA, JD/MBA, Masters in Real Estate, or Masters in Finance program, be starting MBA studies as a first-year student in the Fall, be a minority as defined by the U.S. Department of Labor, and be a U.S. citizen or permanent resident.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All undergraduate fields of study. Specific programs mentioned include: Master of Information Technology (for VT-MIT Scholars); Finance, MBA, JD/MBA, Masters in Real Estate, Masters in Finance (for Toigo MBA Fellowship); Science, Engineering, or Mathematics (for Churchill Foundation Scholarships at Cambridge University).
field_restrictions.restrictions: Primarily need-based for the main MIT Scholarships. Other specific scholarships may have additional restrictions (e.g., career in finance for Toigo, specific fields for Churchill).

academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate degree for the main MIT Scholarships. Master of Information Technology for VT-MIT Scholars. MBA, JD/MBA, Masters in Real Estate, or Masters in Finance for Toigo MBA Fellowship. Graduate study for Churchill Foundation Scholarships.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Students are expected to contribute $2,000 from summer work. Federal Work-Study is a requirement of $3,400.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English proficiency exams are accepted for Regular Action applicants through January test dates (for admissions, which is a prerequisite for financial aid).

additional_requirements.career_plan: Planning to pursue a career in finance after graduation (for Toigo MBA Fellowship).
additional_requirements.age_limits: Between the ages of 19 and 26 (for Churchill Foundation Scholarships).
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: A minority as defined by the U.S. Department of Labor (for Toigo MBA Fellowship).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: U.S. citizen or permanent resident (for Toigo MBA Fellowship). Indian citizenship (for MHRD International Scholarship Program). Must have submitted a complete application to the VT-MIT Program before applying for the VT-MIT Scholars scholarship.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: CSS Profile. A complete application to the VT-MIT Program is required before applying for the VT-MIT Scholars scholarship. General admission application components (general information, essays, activities, academics, etc.) are also required.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Students who apply for financial aid and submit the CSS Profile are automatically considered for MIT Scholarships. MIT has a need-blind admissions policy for all applicants, including international students. Financial aid offers for Early Action applicants are released in mid-January, and for Regular Action applicants in mid-March. Late applicants will receive their financial aid decision later.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: MIT Scholarships are the most common type of aid, providing comprehensive need-based financial aid to ensure access to education regardless of financial circumstances. They are grants that do not need to be repaid. The aid is awarded annually, and recipients must re-apply each year. The program aims to cover the full demonstrated financial need.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Early Action applicants: Financial aid application deadline November 30, offers released mid-January. Regular Action and transfer applicants: Financial aid application deadline February 15, offers released mid-March. Continuing students: Financial aid application deadline February 15 for the following academic year. Prospective first-year students can access offers through the MIT Application Portal until mid-May, then via the Online Financial Aid System.

funding_info.funding_details: Stanford provides comprehensive, need-based financial aid in the form of scholarships (which do not need to be repaid), federal and state grants, and institutional loans. For graduate students, financial support is also provided through external fellowships, Stanford fellowships, research assistantships, and teaching assistantships. The Graduate Student Aid Fund assists a limited number of graduate students with university fees such as the Campus Health Service Fee and Cardinal Care Insurance when those fees cause significant hardship. For specific master's programs, full cost of attendance may be covered for up to 100 students. For parents with total annual income below $150,000 and typical assets, Stanford ensures tuition charges are covered with need-based scholarship, federal/state grants, and/or outside scholarship funds.
covered_expenses: Full cost of attendance (for specific master's programs)

timeline_info.application_deadline: November 15 (Restrictive Early Action), February 15 (Regular Decision), March 15, 2025 (STEP students for Summer 2025–Spring 2026), March 27, 2025 (Summer Institutes), April 15 (Departmental Aid Offer Response)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Stanford's financial aid program is need-based. Eligibility is reassessed each academic year based on family financial circumstances. United States citizens or permanent residents are considered for all types of aid. Stanford institutional need-based financial aid (grant and loans) are available to international students (specifically mentioned for School of Medicine and Online High School). For QuestBridge Match students, parents with total annual income below $150,000 and typical assets will have tuition covered. Graduate students whose actual expenses are significantly higher than standard allowances may submit documentation for budget adjustment and increased loan eligibility.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: STEP students have special application forms and budget information. Financial aid eligibility for Bing Overseas Studies Programs is automatically adjusted. The Graduate Student Aid Fund is for a limited number of graduate students facing significant hardship with university fees. QuestBridge Match students have specific tuition coverage based on parental income and assets. For need-based aid at the School of Medicine, each natural parent must submit financial information and required tax forms. International students applying to Stanford Online High School must complete and submit the SSS International Student Financial Aid Profile form.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: For need-based financial aid at the School of Medicine, each natural parent must submit financial information and required tax forms. International students applying to Stanford Online High School must complete and submit the SSS International Student Financial Aid Profile form.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) (2024–2025 and 2025–2026 versions may be required depending on program/year), Graduate Student Loan Application (Stanford’s online institutional application), Graduate Loan Application 2025–2026, IDOC for submitting tax documents, required tax forms (for parents), SSS International Student Financial Aid Profile form (for international students at Stanford Online High School). A financial aid application fee of $60 USD is required for Summer Institutes, with fee waivers available for financial hardship.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Financial aid is need-based. Applicants can expect to receive notification of financial aid availability at their Stanford email address within 6 to 8 weeks of completing all application requirements. The Financial Aid Office sends email notifications of awards through the University's data system, AXESS. Prospective new students for Stanford Online High School will view their award amount with the admission decision letter in March 2026.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Stanford Financial Aid is a comprehensive, need-based program offering scholarships, federal and state grants, and institutional loans to help students fund their education. It aims to make attendance possible for all admitted undergraduate students without requiring them to borrow to meet their need. Graduate students receive support through a combination of fellowships, assistantships, and loans. Aid is available for both domestic and international students, with specific provisions for various programs and student types (e.g., STEP, QuestBridge, School of Medicine, Online High School).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Financial aid notifications are typically sent within 6 to 8 weeks of completing all application requirements. For Stanford Online High School, prospective new students receive award amounts with their admission decision letter in March 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: A four-year, fully funded educational experience at UNC-Chapel Hill, covering all expenses for undergraduate study and including fully funded summer enrichment activities. It is worth at least $36,000.
covered_expenses: all expenses for four years of undergraduate study

timeline_info.application_deadline: October 15, 2025 (for UNC Early Action, relevant for some applicants via Admissions Referral Program)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details:
Students must apply to the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. Eligibility varies by nomination status and residency:
- US students attending a nominating school/program are eligible if nominated.
- Students outside North Carolina, Canada, or the United Kingdom must attend a nominating school or affiliate program to be considered.
- Students outside North Carolina, Canada, or the United Kingdom who are not attending a nominating school/affiliate may be considered for nomination through the Admissions Referral Program (ARP) if they apply Early Action to UNC-Chapel Hill by October 15, 2025.
- School nominees or direct applicants for the Morehead-Cain are not required to apply by UNC’s Early Action deadline.
- Applicants should be competitive for UNC Chapel Hill and on track to graduate (high school seniors).
- Morehead-Cain applicants may apply Early Decision to other colleges and universities.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All academic disciplines
field_restrictions.restrictions: No restrictions on fields of study.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate (first bachelor's degree)

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Eligibility for nomination varies based on residency (US, North Carolina, Canada, United Kingdom) and attendance at a nominating school or affiliate program. Admissions Referral Program (ARP) is available for certain non-resident, non-nominating school applicants.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants are evaluated based on selection criteria including Scholarship (deep curiosity, reveling in new ideas and different perspectives) and Physical Vigor (challenging oneself). Primarily targets high school seniors.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: School information, senior year courses, and college or guidance counselor details are required.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The selection cycle begins in spring with requests for nominations from counselors and nominating schools/programs. Selection criteria include Scholarship and Physical Vigor.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Morehead-Cain is the first merit scholarship program established in the United States, founded at the first public university in the United States. It offers four distinct experiences designed to accelerate leadership development, including wilderness experiences and professional internships.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The cycle for selecting the Morehead-Cain Class of 2030 will begin in spring 2025, starting with an ask for nominations from counselors and nominating schools and programs.

These can be partially or fully funded, covering tuition fees, living expenses, stipends, and health insurance. Two Presidential Awards will be given to outstanding students, each worth 5,000.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Single application submission through CEU's online system; no separate scholarship applications needed.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Central European University (CEU) is a private, research-intensive university located in Vienna, Austria, accredited in the United States and Austria. Founded in 1991, it offers English-language bachelor’s, master’s and doctoral programs. CEU combines the comparative study of the region’s historical, cultural, and social diversity with a global perspective on good governance, sustainable development and social transformation.

funding_info.funding_details: A $10,000 CDN one-time scholarship.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International students (non-Canadian citizens) who are paying tuition fees and are willing to study for an undergraduate degree program. Must have a U of S Entrance GPA of at least 85%. Eligibility also mentions a maximum of two natural sciences, a maximum of two social sciences or humanities, and a maximum of one fine or performing art.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Natural sciences, social sciences or humanities, fine or performing art

academic_requirements.min_gpa: At least 85% (U of S Entrance GPA)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate degree program

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Show evidence of previous.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: An exciting opportunity for international students looking to study in Canada. It is a one-time scholarship.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Awards mentioned for 2021, 2025, and 2026 academic years, indicating it is an annual scholarship.

basic_info.official_name: The University of Winnipeg President's Scholarship for World Leaders

funding_info.funding_details: Partial Funding, CAD $5,000

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Must be an international student; Must complete an application for admission to The University of Winnipeg; Must be entering the first year of any program (for some divisions/levels); Must demonstrate exceptional leadership or be involved in activities that demonstrate leadership; Must be entering their first program at UWinnipeg; Must be studying in Canada for their first time.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any program; Any of the University's divisions

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 80% admission average or equivalent (Canadian 80% grade average)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Graduate Students (as per official UWinnipeg graduate studies funding page)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Leadership experience (demonstrate exceptional leadership, involved in activities that demonstrate leadership)

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Scholarship for international students to finance studies in Canada; Awarded to international students entering any of the University's divisions; 53 scholarships to international students who will study in Canada for their first time.

covered_expenses: Allowance for accommodation, meals, and other living costs
Funding for textbooks and academic materials
